internecium: <entryFree id="n24364" type="main" key="interne^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, for internecio, <sense id="n24364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slaughter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 26, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internecive: <entryFree id="n24365" type="main" key="interne^ci_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīvē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">internĕcīvus</orth>, v. internecinus.</entryFree>
interneco: <entryFree id="n24366" type="main" key="interne^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nĕco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (ante- and post-class.; cf.: interficio, trucido, etc.). </sense><sense id="n24366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">internecatis hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 34, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24366.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 50</bibl></cit>: culmum, Prud. prooem. Apoth. 61.</sense></entryFree>
internecto: <entryFree id="n24367" type="main" key="internecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-necto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ut fibula crinem Auro internectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagas,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internidifico: <entryFree id="n24368" type="main" key="interni_di^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nīdĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build a nest among</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internigrans: <entryFree id="n24369" type="main" key="interni^grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internĭgrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [inter-nigro], <sense id="n24369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">being black here and there</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">maculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:336" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 336</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interniteo: <entryFree id="n24370" type="main" key="interni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shine forth</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">etiam si qua sidera internitebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid lucis internitebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: internitentes gemmae,<pb n="983" /> <cb n="INTE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 17, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:21" default="NO">7, 11, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internoctatio: <entryFree id="n24371" type="gloss" key="internocta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internoctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inter-nox</etym>, <sense id="n24371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">night-watching</hi>: pernoctatio, excubiae, = <foreign lang="greek">pannuxi/des,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
internodium: <entryFree id="n24372" type="main" key="interno_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nōdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nodus</etym>, <sense id="n24372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between two knots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joints</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an internode</hi> or <hi rend="ital">joint.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24372.1" n="I" level="1"> Of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">harundinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24372.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the leg: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia nervosus facit internodia poples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 256</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24372.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the leg</hi> itself: <cit><quote lang="la">longa internodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internosco: <entryFree id="n24373" type="main" key="internosco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nosco</orth>, <itype>nōvi, nōtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to distinguish between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tell apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to discern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguish</hi> (class.): fortuna dignum atque indignum nequit internoscere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 371 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemini duo, ita forma simili, uti mater sua non internosse posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater geminos internoscit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secerni blandus amicus a vero et internosci potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internosci a falsis non possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut internoscat, visa vera illa sint, anne falsa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
internuculus: <entryFree id="n24374" type="hapax" key="internucu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internucŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives himself up to prostitution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internuncio: <entryFree id="n24375" type="main" key="internunci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internuncĭo</orth>, v. internuntio.</entryFree>
internuncius: <entryFree id="n24376" type="main" key="internunci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internuncĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. internuntius.</entryFree>
internundinium: <entryFree id="n24377" type="main" key="internundi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internundĭnĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">internun-dĭnum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inter-nundinae</etym>, <sense id="n24377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space of time between two</hi> nundinae, Mar. Victorin. p. 2469 P.: quoties rusticus internundino barbam radiebat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 214, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
internuntio: <entryFree id="n24378" type="hapax" key="internunti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nuntĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-nunc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send messengers from both sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper internuntiando cunctatio fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internuntius: <entryFree id="n24379" type="main" key="internunti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-nuntĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">internunc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n24379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves as a messenger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mediator between two parties</hi> or <hi rend="ital">persons;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mediator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">messenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go-between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24379.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-ternuntĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">egone ut ad te ab libertina esse auderem internuntius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internuntiis ultro citroque missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius internuntius et minister rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter absentes negotia contrahuntur, veluti per epistulam aut per internuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:136" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 136</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">The augurs are called Jovis interpretes internuntiique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24379.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">internuntĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves internuntiae Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae internuntiae fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 53, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaea, summi fida internuntia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:545" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 545</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24379.3" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">internuntĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a medium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt internuntia sentiendi,</quote> <trans><tr>the organs of sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 10, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
internus: <entryFree id="n24380" type="main" key="internus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">internus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in; cf. interior, intestinus, intus</etym>, <sense id="n24380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n24380.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24380.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:27:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <trans><tr>inland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 68, 68, § 173</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24380.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">domestic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">civil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">internum simul externumque bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:61:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 61, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24380.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n24380.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Interior parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24380.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Internal</hi> or <hi rend="ital">domestic affairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando ad interna praeverterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24380.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Entrails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24380.8" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the very depths of truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interne</orth>, <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clar. Urb. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intero: <entryFree id="n24381" type="main" key="inte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum</itype> (<sense id="n24381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">second pers. perf.</hi> intrīsti; see below), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to rub into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crumble in</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n24381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">infundito in catinum: eo interito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid potioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 80, § 261</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> Prov.: tute hoc intrīsti: tibi omne est exedendum, <hi rend="ital">you have made this dish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and must eat it up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">you have begun the affair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and must carry it through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quod intrīsti exedendum est, sic vetus verbum jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 6, p. 167</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24381.3" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24381.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bruised to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pounded up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans intrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24381.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Crumbled into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broken into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis triticeus intritus in aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis in lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:9:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 10</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24381.6" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24381.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">paste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mash</hi> of lime, clay, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24381.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">paste</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 265</bibl>. <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interordinatus: <entryFree id="n24382" type="main" key="inte^rordi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ordĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitted together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <trans><tr>fitted into each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inter: <entryFree id="n24383" type="main" key="inte^r2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ordĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ordo</etym>, <sense id="n24383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between two rows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:2" default="NO">4, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:3" default="NO">5, 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpateo: <entryFree id="n24384" type="main" key="interpa^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pătĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be open between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lie between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervene</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senos pedes inter singulas acies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 11, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpedio: <entryFree id="n24385" type="main" key="interpe^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpĕdĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, i. q. impedio, <sense id="n24385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gustatum linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpellatio: <entryFree id="n24386" type="main" key="interpella_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpellātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interpello</etym>, <sense id="n24386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speaking between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an interruption in speaking; an interruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinderance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24386.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi interpellatio aut in consilium huc accessiost?</quote> <trans><tr>What business have you to interrupt?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum orationis interpellatione impedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ulla interpellatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid nobis agentibus novi accidit, interpellatio, interventio alicujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO">9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO">9, 2, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24386.2" n="II" level="1"> In law, <hi rend="ital">a suit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appeal to the court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:188" default="NO">50, 16, 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpellator: <entryFree id="n24387" type="main" key="interpella_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpellātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who interrupts another in speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an interrupter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturber</hi> (class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 11, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se oblectare sine interpellatoribus posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimoniorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a seducer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 5</bibl></cit> Huschke (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:74:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 74, 11, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">cum interpellatores aliis atque aliis causis in jure dicendo (Tiberium) detinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pantomimis duobus, ... alterum saltorem dixit, alterum interpellatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpellatrix: <entryFree id="n24388" type="main" key="interpella_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpellātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interpellator</etym>, <sense id="n24388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that disturbs</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpellatus: <entryFree id="n24389" type="main" key="interpella_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interpello.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24390" type="main" key="interpella_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpellātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n24390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>) [interpello], i. q. interpellatio, <hi rend="ital">a disturbance</hi> (post-class.), Auct. Itin. Alex. M. 31.</sense></entryFree>
interpello: <entryFree id="n24391" type="main" key="interpello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pello</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to interrupt by speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>, etc. (syn. obloquor; class.). </sense><sense id="n24391.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To interrupt by speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi> a person speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">si interpellas, ego tacebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil te interpellabo, continentem orationem audire malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vero, ut me et appelles, et interpelles, et obloquare, et colloquare, velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi interpellamur ab iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">a person engaged in business: si quis te arti tuae intentum sic interpellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 28</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministri, interpellando, . . . atrocitatem facti leniebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24391.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24391.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To annoy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a Ceballino interpellatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe egrediens, ne quis se interpellaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">molest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> one, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24391.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To solicit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">try to seduce</hi> a female: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mulierem puellamve interpellaverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 14</bibl></cit> Huschke (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1, § 2</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n24391.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To address</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak to</hi>, i. q. alloqui: verum tu quid agis? interpella me, ut sciam, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 331, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">= interjicere, interpellantem admonere,</quote> <trans><tr>to object</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:28:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 28, § 71</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24391.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dun</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demand payment of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 3, 6</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24391.7" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obstruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">molest;</hi> constr. with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24391.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in jure suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of things: partam jam victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incrementa urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satietatem epularum ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex Julia non interpellat eam possessionem,</quote> <trans><tr>does not disturb</tr>, <tr>does not abrogate it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiebat T. Ampium conatum esse tollere pecunias ... sed interpellatum adventum Caesaris profugisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tota res interpellata bello refrixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupro interpellato motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24391.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: Caesar numquam interpellavit, quin, quibus vellem, uterer, Matius ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24391.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpellent me, quo minus honoratus sim, dum ne interpellent, quo minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Brut.</author> ad Cic. Fam. 11, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24391.11" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: tribunis<cb n="INTE" />  interregem interpellantibus, ne senatusconsultum fieret, <hi rend="ital">to interpose their veto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pransus non avide, quantum interpellet inani Ventre diem durare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 127</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: fameque et siti interpellante, <hi rend="ital">disturbing</hi> him, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpendium: <entryFree id="n24392" type="main" key="interpendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpendĭum</orth>, v. interpondium.</entryFree>
interpensivus: <entryFree id="n24393" type="main" key="interpensi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pensīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pendeo</etym>, <sense id="n24393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suspended between.</hi> — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interpensīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, (sc. tigilla), <hi rend="ital">cross-beams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interplico: <entryFree id="n24394" type="main" key="interpli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-plĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plait between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:282" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 218</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpolamentum: <entryFree id="n24395" type="main" key="interpo^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>interpolo</etym>, <sense id="n24395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intermixture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admixture</hi> (post-class.), Claud. Mam. de Stat. Anim. praef.</sense></entryFree>
interpolatio: <entryFree id="n24396" type="main" key="interpo^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alteration made here and there</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tenuatam (chartam) curiosa interpolatione, principalem fecit e plebeia,</quote> <trans><tr>by a curious dressing made the best paper from common</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpolator: <entryFree id="n24397" type="main" key="interpo^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives another appearance to things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a polisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furbisher; a corrupter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiler</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">multum est inter institutorem et interpolatorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satanas totius saeculi interpolator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Testim. Anim. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpolatrix: <entryFree id="n24398" type="main" key="interpo^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interpolator</etym>, <sense id="n24398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that alters the appearance of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a falsifier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupter</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Constant. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpolis: <entryFree id="n24399" type="main" key="interpo^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inter-polio</etym>, <sense id="n24399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has received a new appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altered by furbishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vamped up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repaired;</hi> esp., <hi rend="ital">falsified</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not genuine</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vestimenta interpola quis pro novis emerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 45</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24399.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">istaec veteres (mulieres), quae se unguentis unctitant, interpoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatur ars quotidie, toties interpolis,</quote> <trans><tr>new vamped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpolo: <entryFree id="n24400" type="main" key="interpo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>interpolio; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 34, 2 sq.</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n24400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give a new form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">appearance to</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furbish</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dress up; to spoil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsify; to vary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi> (class.; cf. interlino, vitio, transscribo). </sense><sense id="n24400.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam praetextam,</quote> <trans><tr>to dye anew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24400.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24400.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: illic homo me interpolabit, meumque os finget denuo, <hi rend="ital">will work me up anew</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will bang me into another shape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova pictura interpolare vis opus lepidissimum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to paint the lily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <trans><tr>to prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24400.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of the falsification of writings, <hi rend="ital">to insert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpolate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falsify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper aliquid demendo, mutando, interpolando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:61:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 61, § 158</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturas divinas, Ambros. de Fide, 5, 16, 193: priorem textum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpondium: <entryFree id="n24401" type="gloss" key="interpondi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pondĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">interpendĭ-um</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pondus</etym>, <sense id="n24401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">equipoise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equilibrium</hi>: interpondium, <foreign lang="greek">para/llhlon,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interpono: <entryFree id="n24402" type="main" key="interpo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insert between.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24402.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24402.2" n="A" level="2"> Of place, constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus praesidia levis armaturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:17" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:13" default="NO">13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:19" default="NO">19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus interponi eam (herbam) gratissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi spatium inter muros ... pilae interponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eos levis armaturae Numidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti levis armatura interjecta inter equites suos interponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne interpositi quidem elephanti militem deterrebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateri vinculum lapides sunt, quos interposuere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24402.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24402.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To insert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce.</hi>—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">intercalariis mensibus interpositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inediam unius diei per singulos menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl></cit>.—Of musical notes: <cit><quote lang="la">iis sonis quos interposuerant, inserunt alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 68</bibl></cit>.—Of words or language: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inquam et inquit saepius interponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc loco libet interponere ... quantae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: subinde interponenti precibus, quid respondebo, <pb n="984" /> <cb n="INTE" /> etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis interpositis versibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum ullum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5</bibl></cit> prooem. 3. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of a letter in a word: quibusdam (verbis litteram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—Of a foot in verse: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam (iambus) interpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24402.5" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to let pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit to elapse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi> an interval: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium ad recreandos animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei causa moram interponi arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tridui mora interposita,</quote> <trans><tr>after a delay of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam moram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam moram, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatio interposito,</quote> <trans><tr>some time after</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus aliquot interpositis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore interposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 49, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac interposita nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24402.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mingle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidam (cibis),</quote> <trans><tr>to drink cold water while eating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">condimentis cuminum,</quote> <trans><tr>to mix with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 15, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24402.7" n="C" level="2"> With personal objects, <hi rend="ital">to introduce among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admit among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring into</hi> a feast, a society, <hi rend="ital">among</hi> associates, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sancta sit societas civium, dis immortalibus interpositis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos familiaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24402.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in the way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put forward.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24402.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., as a hinderance, interference, reason, or pretext: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus provinciam, quam sorte habebat, interposita religione, deposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ulla belli suspicione interposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla interposita dubitatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:52" default="NO">52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interposita pactione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensione aliqua interposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec colloquium interposita causa tolli volebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 70" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam interponens collegas exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postulata haec ab eo interposita esse, quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam, studium, laborem pro sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:in Caecin. 19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecin. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24402.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24402.11" n="1" level="3"> Of a judgment, decree, edict, oath, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando interposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 25, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus eo die se non dicturum, neque decretum interpositurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad decreta interponenda pecuniam occipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas compromissaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptionem actioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessionem suam (of a tribune of the people),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutor interponit auctoritatem suam,</quote> <trans><tr>gives his authorization</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:190" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 190</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24402.12" n="2" level="3"> Fidem interponere, <hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">credit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suam in eam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem reliquis interponere, jusjurandum poscere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suam in re omni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 63" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni interposita fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in eam rem fidem suam, si quid opus esse putaret, interponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsio interponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24402.13" n="3" level="3"> Se interponere (in aliquid, or alicui rei; also with <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to interfere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermeddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self in the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te in istam pacificationem non interponis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num ego me non interpono Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:10:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num quem putas posse reperiri, qui se interponat, quominus, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim me interponerem audaciae tuae?</quote> <trans><tr>expose myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni tribuni plebis interposuissent se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6</bibl></cit>: tu vero, quod voles, facies; <cit><quote lang="la">me nihil interpono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.— Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to interfere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpose</hi> in behalf of any one: <cit><quote lang="la">semper se interposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui me mediis interposuerim Caesaris scriptis, i.e. by writing a continuation,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8 praef" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interpositio: <entryFree id="n24403" type="main" key="interpo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interpono</etym>, <sense id="n24403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insertion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24403.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tetrastyli, propter columnarum interpositiones, spatiosiores constituantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24403.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24403.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An inserting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi> of persons in discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of words: una interpositio difficilior est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24403.4" n="B" level="2"> A rhet. figure, <hi rend="ital">parenthesis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpositus: <entryFree id="n24404" type="main" key="interpo^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. interpono <sense id="n24404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24405" type="main" key="interpo^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (only in <sense id="n24405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a putting between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interposition</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">luna interpositu interjectuque terrae repente deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis radios luna interpositu suo auferens terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpremo: <entryFree id="n24406" type="main" key="interpre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-prĕmo</orth>, v. interprimo.</entryFree>
interpres: <entryFree id="n24407" type="main" key="interpre^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-prĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>inter, and Sanscr. root prath-, to spread abroad; cf. <foreign lang="greek">platu/s,</foreign> latus</etym>. <sense id="n24407.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An agent between two parties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a broker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negotiator</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod te praesente isti egi, teque interprete,</quote> <trans><tr>through your agency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ego ei rei sim interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ea res per me interpretem curetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 1, 6: interpretes corrumpendi judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12</bibl></cit>: divūm, <hi rend="ital">the messenger of the gods</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 356</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 359</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum curarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno</tr>, <tr>the goddess of marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 608</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24407.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An explainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi> (syn. internuntius): <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:544" default="NO">6, 544</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatici interpretes poëtarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>an astronomer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis est oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus interpres semper in deteriora inclinatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 44</bibl></cit>: comitiorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Haruspices</hi>, who can tell whether or not the comitia are properly held, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a soothsayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec converti, ut interpres, sed ut orator,</quote> <trans><tr>a translator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indiserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpres veridica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24407.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an interpreter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragoman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotidianis interpretibus remotis, per C. Valerium cum eo (Divitiaco) colloquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare aliquem per interpretem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquem cum interprete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteraeque lectae per interpretem sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interpretabilis: <entryFree id="n24408" type="main" key="interpre^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interpretor</etym>, <sense id="n24408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be explained</hi> or <hi rend="ital">translated</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretamentum: <entryFree id="n24409" type="main" key="interpre^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">obscurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci (verbi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus rei Latinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:18:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretatio: <entryFree id="n24410" type="main" key="interpre^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātĭo</orth>, ōnis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24410.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentorum et somniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl>: exemplo adjuvare interpretationem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=273" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 273</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24410.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24410.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A translation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">version</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetoricen in Latinum transferentes oratoriam nominaverunt . . . et haec interpretatio dura est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24410.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Signification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Graecum sermonem per interpretationem proprie transferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:92" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n24410.4" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an explanation of one expression by another</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 28, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:98" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretatiuncula: <entryFree id="n24411" type="main" key="interpre^ta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>interpretatio</etym>, <sense id="n24411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brief explanation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretator: <entryFree id="n24412" type="main" key="interpre^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>interpretor</etym>, <sense id="n24412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an explainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpreter</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque testamenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Monog. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretatorius: <entryFree id="n24413" type="main" key="interpre^ta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interpretator</etym>, <sense id="n24413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to an interpreter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interpretatus: <entryFree id="n24414" type="main" key="interpre^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. interpretor <sense id="n24414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interpretium: <entryFree id="n24415" type="main" key="interpre^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-prĕtĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the difference between the buying and selling price</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profit</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 18</bibl>; cf.: interpretium <foreign lang="greek">para/llhlon,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interpretor: <entryFree id="n24416" type="main" key="interpre^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n24416.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inter quaecumque pretantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 832</bibl></cit>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>interpres</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to explain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give expression to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translate; to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appreciate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24416.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuae memoriae interpretari me aequom censes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam aliud est philosophia, si interpretari velis, quam studium sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra aut fulgura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera de genere hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mitiorem in partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Mur. 31:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 64</bibl></cit>: felicitatem alicujus grato animo,<cb n="INTE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:Brut. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male bene dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:N. D. 3:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grate beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male beneficium fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:47:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 47, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui scriptum recitet et scriptoris voluntatem non interpretetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio responso spem ad voluntatem interpretantibus fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscure dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aenigmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgori/a,</foreign> quam inversionem interpretamur, <hi rend="ital">translate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:25" default="NO">2, 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plerique ... viso aspectoque Agricola quaererent famam, pauci interpretarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>few understood him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa ducum interpretari quam exsequi malle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditu enim in castra, liberatum se esse jurejurando, interpretabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomoerium verbi vim solam intuentes postmoerium interpretantur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam ut suam,</quote> <trans><tr>claimed as his own</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite consilium ex necessitate, nec voluntatem ex vi interpretari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem ex consuetudine vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: Chaldaeos interpretatos imperium Persarum ad eos transiturum, <hi rend="ital">interpret signs</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">predict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foretell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24416.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24416.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, recte, an perperam, interpretor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24416.4" n="B" level="2"> Memoriae alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to assist one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s memory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24416.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To translate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte sententiam (v. the context),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24416.6" n="D" level="2"> Diabolo, <hi rend="ital">to ascribe to the devil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 15</bibl>.?*! In <hi rend="ital">pass. sense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae, quae male de Hebraicis interpretata sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo ita illud somnium esse interpretatum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Naarmalcha, quod amnis regum interpretatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6</bibl></cit>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">interprĕtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">explained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">translated</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ex Graeco carmine interpretata recitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 29, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interprimo: <entryFree id="n24417" type="main" key="interpri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-prĭmo</orth>, <itype>pressi, pressum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>premo</etym>, <sense id="n24417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squeeze to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crush</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24417.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sacerdoti scelestus faucis interpresserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24417.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to suppress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interprominius: <entryFree id="n24418" type="main" key="Interpromi^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Interpromĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in the territory of the Marrucini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">S. Valentino</hi>, Inscr. ap. Romanelli, Topogr. Napol. 3, 117.</sense></entryFree>
interpunctio: <entryFree id="n24419" type="main" key="interpuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interpungo</etym>, <sense id="n24419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing of points between words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpunctuation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpunctiones verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpunctum: <entryFree id="n24420" type="main" key="interpunctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpunctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. interpunctio, <sense id="n24420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separating of words by points</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpunctuation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpuncta verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpunctus: <entryFree id="n24421" type="main" key="interpunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interpunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. interpungo <sense id="n24421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
