interpungo: <entryFree id="n24422" type="main" key="interpungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pungo</orth>, <itype>punxi, punctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place points between words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punctuate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scribimus, interpungere consuevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-punctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">well divided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narratio distincta personis et interpuncta sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 44, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpuncta verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>divisions by punctuation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interpurgo: <entryFree id="n24423" type="main" key="interpurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-purgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleanse here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 243</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interputo: <entryFree id="n24424" type="main" key="interpu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-pŭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prune here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interqueror: <entryFree id="n24425" type="main" key="interque^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-quĕror</orth>, <itype>questus sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interquaesti sunt, false reading for leniter questi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 35, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interquiesco: <entryFree id="n24426" type="main" key="interqui^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-quĭesco</orth>, <itype>quĭēvi, quĭētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rest between whiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest a while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pause</hi>, </sense><sense id="n24426.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">bibe, interquiesce,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec dixissem et paululum interquievissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 91</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24426.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interrado: <entryFree id="n24427" type="main" key="interra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rādo</orth>, <itype>rāsi, rāsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (al. most exclusively in Pliny and Columella). <sense id="n24427.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to scrape here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrasa cortice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 254</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24427.1" n="B" level="2"> <pb n="985" /> <cb n="INTE" /> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to emboss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">work in low relief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera vasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24427.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To prune here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleae interradi gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interrasilis: <entryFree id="n24428" type="main" key="interra_si^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrāsĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interrado</etym>, <sense id="n24428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraped here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worked in low relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embossed</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus, Ven. Carm. 1, 13, 15: corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 25 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interrasor: <entryFree id="n24429" type="gloss" key="interra_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filigreeworker</hi>: interrasor, <foreign lang="greek">diakrinhth/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interrasus: <entryFree id="n24430" type="main" key="interra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interrado.</entryFree>
interregnum: <entryFree id="n24431" type="main" key="interregnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-regnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the time between the death of one king and the election of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an interregnum</hi>: populus flagitare regem non destitit; <cit><quote lang="la">cum . . . illi principes novam interregni ineundi rationem excogitaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ab re, quod nunc quoque tenet nomen, interregnum appellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24431.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, under the republic, <hi rend="ital">the time between the death or departure of the consuls and the choice of new ones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad interregnum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem adduci ad interregnum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per interregnum renovare auspicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: interregnum inire, <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> interrex, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interrex: <entryFree id="n24432" type="main" key="interrex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rex</orth>, <itype>rēgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who held the regal office between the death of one king and the election of another; a regent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24432.1" n="II" level="1"> During the times of the republic, <hi rend="ital">one who held the supreme power from the death or absence of the chief magistrates till the election of new ones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Flaccus interrex legem de Sulla tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:15:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 15, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodere,</quote> <trans><tr>to nominate</tr>, <tr>appoint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infestam patribus plebem interreges cum accepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interrite: <entryFree id="n24433" type="main" key="interri^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. interritus <sense id="n24433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interritus: <entryFree id="n24434" type="main" key="interri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-terrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undaunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undismayed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unterrified</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">impavidus): bracchia interritus extulit ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatque interrita pugnas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis interrita fertur,</quote> <trans><tr>fearless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:863" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 863</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:9 al" default="NO">3, 6, 9 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens interrita leti,</quote> <trans><tr>unterrified at death</tr>, <tr>not afraid of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 616</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interrĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">undauntedly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 16 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
interrivatio: <entryFree id="n24435" type="main" key="interri_va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rīvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>rivo</etym>, <sense id="n24435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing off of water between two places</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 661</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interrivatus: <entryFree id="n24436" type="main" key="interri_va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rīvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, of water, <sense id="n24436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawn off between two places</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 584</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">627</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interrogamentum: <entryFree id="n24437" type="gloss" key="interro^ga_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>interrogo</etym>, i. q. interrogatio, <sense id="n24437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogation</hi>: interrogamentum, <foreign lang="greek">peu=sis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
interroganter: <entryFree id="n24438" type="main" key="interro^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏganter</orth>, v. interrogo <sense id="n24438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interrogatio: <entryFree id="n24439" type="main" key="interro^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a questioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogation</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24439.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia per interrogationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instare interrogatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris inclusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:3:6:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 3, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis obligatio fit ex interrogatione et responsione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:92" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 92</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24439.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24439.3" n="A" level="2"> As rhet. fig., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:98" default="NO">9, 3, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24439.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte genus hoc interrogationis ignavum ac iners nominatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
interrogatiuncula: <entryFree id="n24440" type="main" key="interro^ga_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>interrogatio</etym>, <sense id="n24440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short argument</hi> or <hi rend="ital">syllogism</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutae, Cic. prooem. Par.: nectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interrogative: <entryFree id="n24441" type="main" key="interro^ga_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. interrogativus <sense id="n24441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
interrogativus: <entryFree id="n24442" type="main" key="interro^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interrogo</etym>, <sense id="n24442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1059</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">interrogatively</hi>, Ps.-Ascon. ap. Verr. 2, 1, 56; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 41</bibl>; Schol. Vet. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interrogator: <entryFree id="n24443" type="main" key="interro^ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interrogator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:11:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 1, 11, § 7</bibl>: mortuorum, <hi rend="ital">a wizard</hi>, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 1, 2. <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interrogatorius: <entryFree id="n24444" type="main" key="interro^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interrogator</etym>, <sense id="n24444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of questions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogatory</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">actiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interrogo: <entryFree id="n24445" type="main" key="interro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rŏgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogate</hi> (syn.: percontor, sciscitor; class.). </sense><sense id="n24445.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod te interrogo, responde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pusionem quendam interrogat Socrates quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogas me, num,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: tunc sententiae interrogari coeptae, <hi rend="ital">judgments</hi> or <hi rend="ital">votes to be taken;</hi> esp., in the Senate: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogare sententias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec, quae interrogatus es, responde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium interrogatus miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa interrogavit illam: Qui scis? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodius interrogabat suos, quis esset, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud interrogo,</quote> <trans><tr>I put this question</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil plus interrogo,</quote> <trans><tr>I have no more to ask</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24445.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24445.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interrogate judicially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine; to go to law with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring an action against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes in reos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene testem,</quote> <trans><tr>to cross-question a witness in such a manner as to make him contradict himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legibus interrogari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 47, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me umquam ulla lege interrogavit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:29:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 29, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules legibus ambitūs interrogati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pepigerat Pallas, ne cujus facti in praeteritum interrogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnatus Priscus repetundarum, Bithynis interrogantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 46</bibl></cit>; 16, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n24445.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason syllogistically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Posidonius sic interrogandum ait: Quae neque magnitudinem animo dant, nec securitatem, non sunt bona: divitiae nihil horum faciunt: ergo non sunt bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24445.5" n="C" level="2"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogandi casus,</quote> <trans><tr>the genitive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:25:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24445.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: si versum pangis, etc., aurem tuam interroga, quo quid loco conveniat dicere, <hi rend="ital">consult</hi>, Prob. Val. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 1 sq.</bibl> — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">interrŏganter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">interrogatively</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug. in Job, 34.</sense></entryFree>
interrumpo: <entryFree id="n24446" type="main" key="interrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype> (in tmesi: <sense id="n24446.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inter quasi rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter quasi rupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 299</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to break apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break up</hi> (class., esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n24446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">contingere idem terrae necesse est, ut nihil interrumpat, quo labefactari possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrupta et impervia itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>scattered about</tr>, <tr>here and there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 239</bibl></cit>.—Of bridges, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 66</bibl>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>.—Of the ranks of an army, esp. the enemy's line: <cit><quote lang="la">interrupta acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24446.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter amoris et officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contextum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni medici adventus nos interrupisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">interruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">interrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictio silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">interruptē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">interruptedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 329</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interruptio: <entryFree id="n24447" type="main" key="interrupti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interruptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interrumpo</etym>, <sense id="n24447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n24447.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 9, 3, § 12</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 622</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 5, 32</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24447.3" n="A" level="2"> Rhet. t. t., = <foreign lang="greek">a)posiw/phsis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a sudden break in the thought</hi> or <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam idem Cicero reticentiam, Celsus obticentiam, nonnulli interruptionem appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24447.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpatio est usucapionis interruption,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24447.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A breaking up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interruptor: <entryFree id="n24448" type="gloss" key="interruptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interruptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interrupter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spoiler</hi>: interruptor, <foreign lang="greek">diafqoreu/s,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
interruptus: <entryFree id="n24449" type="main" key="interruptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interruptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. interrumpo <sense id="n24449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intersaepio: <entryFree id="n24450" type="main" key="intersaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-saepĭo</orth>, <itype>saepsi, saeptum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24450.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fence about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hedge in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina intersaepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam operibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muro intersaepta urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem densis arbustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24450.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprive of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallo urbem ab arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui conspectum abeuntis exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendio intersaepti ab hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersaeptum: <entryFree id="n24451" type="main" key="intersaeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intersaeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>intersaepio</etym>, <sense id="n24451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the midriff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diaphragm</hi>: intersaeptum, <foreign lang="greek">dia/fragma,</foreign> Gloss. Philox. — </sense><sense id="n24451.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a boundary</hi>: regnorum, Aus. Grat. Act. § 82.</sense></entryFree>
intersaeptus: <entryFree id="n24452" type="main" key="intersaeptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intersaeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intersaepio.</entryFree>
interscalmium: <entryFree id="n24453" type="main" key="interscalmi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-scalmĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scalmus</etym>, <sense id="n24453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between two oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interscalptus: <entryFree id="n24454" type="main" key="interscalptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-scalptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">engraved in the middle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented with carved work in the middle</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:58" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interscapilium: <entryFree id="n24455" type="main" key="intersca^pi^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-scăpĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scapula</etym>, <sense id="n24455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the shoulders</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 14, p. 350, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 11, 1, 93</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:77" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interscindo: <entryFree id="n24456" type="main" key="interscindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, scissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">break down; to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24456.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24456.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chalcis arto interscinditur freto, Liv 28, 7: ruina interscindit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinculum animi atque amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interscribo: <entryFree id="n24457" type="main" key="interscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-scrībo</orth>, <itype>scripsi, scriptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write between</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24457.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia interscribere alia rescribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24457.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the phœnix: <cit><quote lang="la">in cauda (phoenicis) caeruleus interscribitur nitor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is intermingled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the agate: interscribentes eum venae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>running between</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersecivus: <entryFree id="n24458" type="main" key="interse^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intersĕcīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>interseco</etym>, <sense id="n24458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. 112" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interseco: <entryFree id="n24459" type="main" key="interse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sĕco</orth>, <itype>sĕcui, sectum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intersect</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis media intersecans moenia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam paludem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum ductibus intersectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telluris complexum intersecat (Nilus) multitudine fluviorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 626</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24459.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fix in channels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impress deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa pronuntiatione eas res ... inserere atque insecare in animis auditorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersectio: <entryFree id="n24460" type="main" key="intersecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intersectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interseco</etym>, <sense id="n24460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intersection;</hi> in archit., <hi rend="ital">the part cut out between two teeth in indented work</hi>: intersectio, quae Graece <foreign lang="greek">metoxh/</foreign> dicitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interseminatus: <entryFree id="n24461" type="main" key="interse_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intersēmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [intersemino], <sense id="n24461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sown between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at intervals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersepio: <entryFree id="n24462" type="main" key="interse_pio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sēpio</orth>, etc., v. intersaepio, etc.</entryFree>
intersero: <entryFree id="n24463" type="main" key="interse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, sĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. sero</etym>, <sense id="n24463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malleolum vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:7" default="NO">3, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomis intersita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1377</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24463.1" n="II" level="1"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se vallis interserat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis ossibus spinisve intersitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intersĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">put between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quatuor venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit>: area vacanti intersita, Gall. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 301</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24464" type="main" key="interse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sĕrŭi, sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. sero</etym>, <sense id="n24464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam interserens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula mediis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:559" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 559</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersileo: <entryFree id="n24465" type="main" key="intersi^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sĭlĕo</orth>, <itype>ui</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be silent in the meanwhile</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ord. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ord. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intersisto: <entryFree id="n24466" type="main" key="intersisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stand still in the middle;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to stop in the midst</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a pause</hi> in speaking (perhaps only in Quint.); <cit><quote lang="la">of a speaker: indecentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut intersistat fatigatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:10" default="NO">10, 7, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of discourse: oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi intersistatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ubi clausulis non intersistitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 106</bibl></cit>. <pb n="986" /> <cb n="INTE" /></sense></entryFree>
intersitus: <entryFree id="n24467" type="main" key="intersi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. intersero <sense id="n24467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intersono: <entryFree id="n24468" type="main" key="interso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sŏno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sound among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:344" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 344</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interspatium: <entryFree id="n24469" type="main" key="interspa^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-spătĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n24469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Orat. 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interspersus: <entryFree id="n24470" type="main" key="interspersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-spersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>spargo</etym>, <sense id="n24470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strewn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprinkled upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interspersed</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">interspersus rara canitie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt multa naturae munere interspersa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 299, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interspiratio: <entryFree id="n24471" type="main" key="interspi_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interspīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interspiro</etym>, <sense id="n24471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fetching of breath between</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 18, § 29</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequalibus interspirationibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
interspiro: <entryFree id="n24472" type="main" key="interspi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-spīro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fetch breath between;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to admit air</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua interspirat (operculum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intersterno: <entryFree id="n24473" type="main" key="intersterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to strew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi> (perh. only in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">bitumine interstrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assulis interstratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interstes: <entryFree id="n24474" type="main" key="interste^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstĕs</orth>, <itype>stĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intersto</etym>, <sense id="n24474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that stands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interstinctio: <entryFree id="n24475" type="main" key="interstincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interstinguo</etym>, <sense id="n24475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distribution</hi> of gems, set here and there (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 191</bibl> (al. interstitio).</sense></entryFree>
interstinctus: <entryFree id="n24476" type="main" key="interstinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. interstinguo.</entryFree>
interstinguo: <entryFree id="n24477" type="main" key="interstinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-stinguo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stinxi</orth>), <itype>stinctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24477.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide; to variegate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">checker with</hi> any thing (only in <hi rend="ital">perf. pass.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">spatia interstincta columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies medicaminibus interstincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candor interstinctus variis coloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureum capitis figmentum interstinctum lapillis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24477.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24477.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To extinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae faciunt ignes interstingui atque perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor interstinctis aquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 915</bibl></cit> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>— </sense><sense id="n24477.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interstitio: <entryFree id="n24478" type="main" key="intersti^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intersisto</etym>. <sense id="n24478.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi>, Gell. praef. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 1, 43</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24478.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interstitio fieri quae poterit singulorum, cum, qui Juppiter fuerat, idem possit existimari Mars esse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interstitium: <entryFree id="n24479" type="main" key="intersti^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a space between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interstice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24479.1" n="I" level="1"> Of place, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 837</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24479.2" n="II" level="1"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">an interval</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum interstitii dies habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 601</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 600</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intersto: <entryFree id="n24480" type="main" key="intersto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sto</orth>, <itype>stĕti, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the midst of</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus interstat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 9, 4</bibl>. —With <case>acc.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 849</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interstratus: <entryFree id="n24481" type="main" key="interstra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n24481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi> of intersterno.</sense></entryFree>
interstrepo: <entryFree id="n24482" type="main" key="interstre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-strĕpo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a noise among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound in the midst of</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): Nereus undis, Claud. in. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 2, 303</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 36</bibl>, the correct read. is inter strepere).</sense></entryFree>
interstringo: <entryFree id="n24483" type="main" key="interstringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-stringo</orth>, <itype>strinxi, strictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to squeeze tight</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui gulam,</quote> <trans><tr>to throttle</tr>, <tr>strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interstruo: <entryFree id="n24484" type="main" key="interstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-strŭo</orth>, <itype>struxi, structum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join together; to add</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qua spina interstruit artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:147" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam distinctionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
intersum: <entryFree id="n24485" type="main" key="intersum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, esse</itype> (interfŭtūrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl>; <sense id="n24485.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in tmesi: interque esse desiderat pugnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 255</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to be between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie between</hi> (class.; syn. interjaceo). </sense><sense id="n24485.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n24485.2" n="A" level="2"> Of space: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (segetes) inter et castra unus omnino collis intererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Tiberis inter eos et pons interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via interest perangusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morari victoriam rati, quod interesset amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod interest spatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24485.3" n="B" level="2"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus inter primum et sextum consulatum sex et quadraginta anni interfuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>elapsed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 17, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter Laviniam et Albam Longam coloniam deductam triginta ferme interfuere anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24485.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24485.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be apart;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">abl. of distance</hi> (syn. <cb n="INTE" /> disto): <cit><quote lang="la">clathros interesse oportet pede,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24485.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to differ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter eos, ne minimum quidem intersit,</quote> <trans><tr>there is not the slightest difference</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: inter hominem et beluam hoc maxime interest, quod, <hi rend="ital">men differ chiefly from brutes in this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide, quantum interfuturum sit inter meam atque tuam accusationem,</quote> <trans><tr>how great a difference there will be</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his rebus nihil omnino interest,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no difference whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc pater ac dominus interest,</quote> <trans><tr>there is this difference</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum id interest, veneritne eo itinere ad urbem, an ab urbe in Campaniam redierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> (like differo, rare): <cit><quote lang="la">negant quidquam a falsis interesse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod intersit aut differat, aliud ab alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ab eo nihil intersit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 83</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut matrona Intererit Satyris paulum pudibunda protervis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 232</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dimidium dimidiato intersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (in analogy with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diafe/rein tino/s</foreign>): quoniam <foreign lang="greek">to\ nemesa=n</foreign> interest (= <foreign lang="greek">diafe/rei</foreign>) <foreign lang="greek">tou= fqonei=n,</foreign> i. e. <hi rend="ital">anger differs from envy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> — </sense><sense id="n24485.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be present at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take part in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n24485.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac si ipse interfuerit, ac praesens viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:54:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 54, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interfuisse me memini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24485.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus gerendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:18:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populo Quirini,</quote> <trans><tr>to be among</tr>, <tr>live with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus divinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 38</bibl></cit>.— Also, with <hi rend="ital">dat. loci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contubernio patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 27:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 27, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also, with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificanti interfuit,</quote> <trans><tr>attended him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24485.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in testamento faciendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluerunt eos in suis rebus ipsos interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus in rebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>.— Also used of time, <hi rend="ital">to live in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis illis temporibus interfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tempori Saturninus interfuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (ratiocinatio) dicitur interfuisse tum, cum aliquid vitasse aut secutus esse animus videbitur,</quote> <trans><tr>to have taken place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24485.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be of interest</hi> to one (very rare as <hi rend="ital">pers. verb</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">non quo mea interesset natura loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. interest, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> infra). — </sense><sense id="n24485.12" n="III" level="1"> Esp.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrest</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it makes a difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concerns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imports; is of interest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importance;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen. pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meā</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tuā</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suā</hi>, and with a <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea vos rata habeatis, ne magis reipublicae interest, quam mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto opere reipublicae communisque salutis intersit, manus hostium distineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper ille, quantum interesset P. Clodii, se perire, cogitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illius interest, ubi sis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim est hodie, cujus intersit istam legem manere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vehementer interest rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego et mea et rei publicae interesse arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum interest rei familiaris tuae, te quam primum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuā et meā maxime interest, te valere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ignorare eos velis, quorum intersit id scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 13, 57</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud meā magni interest, te ut videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ut facias tuā interesse arbitror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestrā interest, ne imperatorem pessimi faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam suā quam reipublicae interesse ut salvus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque nostrum magni interest ut te videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit> B. and K. (dub.).— With <hi rend="ital">gen. pretii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod meus familiaris tanti suā interesse arbitraretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus novis conjunctionibus interest, qualis primus aditus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: non tam interest, quo animo scribatur, quam quo accipiatur, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque multum interest, quod nondum per numeros distributi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">utrum ... an</hi>: quid interfuit, homo <cb n="INTE" /> audacissime, utrum hoc decerneres, an, etc., <hi rend="ital">what mattered it?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:61:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 61, § 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil interest nunc, an violaverim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad honorem interesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad decus et ad laudem civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laudem nostram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad beate vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertaleo: <entryFree id="n24486" type="main" key="interta_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-tālĕo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>talea</etym>, <sense id="n24486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut out between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut by lopping off both ends</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 414, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intertexo: <entryFree id="n24487" type="main" key="intertexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-texo</orth>, <itype>texŭi, textum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24487.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to intertwine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intersperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores hederis intertexti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis intertexta notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chlamys auro intertexta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 167</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24487.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to interweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">construct</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fabricator mundanae animae Deus partes ejus ex pari et impari intertexuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertextus: <entryFree id="n24488" type="main" key="intertextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intertextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intertexo.</entryFree>
intertignium: <entryFree id="n24489" type="main" key="intertigni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-tignĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tignum</etym>, <sense id="n24489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the interval</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space between two beams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intertortus: <entryFree id="n24490" type="hapax" key="intertortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-tortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wound between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intertwisted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intertorto pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
intertraho: <entryFree id="n24491" type="hapax" key="intertra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-trăho</orth>, <itype>traxi, tractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi animam omnem intertraxero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertriginosus: <entryFree id="n24492" type="main" key="intertri_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intertrīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intertrigo</etym>, <sense id="n24492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chafed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">galled</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intertrigo: <entryFree id="n24493" type="main" key="intertri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-trīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n24493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chafing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fretting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">galling of the skin</hi> in riding, walking, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=176" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 176</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">intertrigines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 53, § 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertrimentum: <entryFree id="n24494" type="main" key="intertri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-trīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inter-tero; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=176" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 176</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n24494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loss by attrition</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">waste</hi> of gold or silver in melting or working it. </sense><sense id="n24494.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24494.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">damage</hi> (syn.: detrimentum, jactura): sine ullo intertrimento, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 132</bibl> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">sine magno intertrimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum intertrimenti aut deminutionis vestigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertritura: <entryFree id="n24495" type="main" key="intertri_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-trītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loss by attrition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wear and tear</hi>, i. q. intertrimentum: <cit><quote lang="la">culleorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:43:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 43, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intertrudo: <entryFree id="n24496" type="main" key="intertru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-trūdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust between</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ord. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ord. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
