interturbatio: <entryFree id="n24497" type="hapax" key="interturba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interturbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interturbo</etym>, <sense id="n24497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disquietude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre animi quoque ejus haud mirabilem interturbationem causante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interturbo: <entryFree id="n24498" type="main" key="interturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-turbo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to produce disquietude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause a disturbance</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne interturba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 12</bibl> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Bentl. ad h. l.): qui interturbare gestit affectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 38, § 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interturrium: <entryFree id="n24499" type="gloss" key="interturri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interturrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>inter-turris</etym>, <sense id="n24499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wall between two towers</hi>, Inscr. ap. Don. 220, 3.</sense></entryFree>
interulus: <entryFree id="n24500" type="main" key="interu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n24500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [inter], <hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inner</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 888</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans><tr>under-garment</tr>, <tr>shirt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 9</bibl></cit>. — Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interulae dilores duae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Bonos. 15, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interundatus: <entryFree id="n24501" type="hapax" key="inte^runda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-undātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">done in waves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watered</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interusurium: <entryFree id="n24502" type="main" key="inte^ru_su_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĕr-ūsūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>usura</etym>, <sense id="n24502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">interest accruing in the meantime</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:9:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 9, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:section=66" default="NO">35, 2, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intervacans: <entryFree id="n24503" type="main" key="interva^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-văcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vaco], <sense id="n24503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">being empty between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervacantibus spatiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervallatio: <entryFree id="n24504" type="main" key="intervalla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intervallātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> <etym>intervallo</etym>, <sense id="n24504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interval</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frequenti intervallatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. Diaet. Pass. 42" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. Diaet. Pass. 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intervallo: <entryFree id="n24505" type="main" key="intervallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vallo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vallum</etym>, <sense id="n24505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assume at intervals</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">intervallando potestates assiduas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 11</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intervallātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having intervals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris,</quote> <trans><tr>intermittent fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallato brevi tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>after a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervallum: <entryFree id="n24506" type="main" key="intervallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, prop., <sense id="n24506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the open space within the mound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breastwork of a camp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the space between two palisades.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24506.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: opus, pedum sexaginta, quod est inter vallum et legiones ... a quibusdam intervallum<pb n="987" /> <cb n="INTE" />  cognominatum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Munit. Cast. 6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Munit. Cast. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervalla sunt spatia inter capita vallorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 15, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24506.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">space between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes directae, paribus intervallis in solo collocantur. Ea autem intervalla grandibus saxis effarciuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pari intervallo,</quote> <trans><tr>at an equal distance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respiciens videt magnis intervallis sequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius signi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum et temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex intervallo,</quote> <trans><tr>from a distance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:48:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 48, 44, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximus longo intervallo insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes modicis intervallis disponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque milium intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille passuum intervallo distantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 1</bibl></cit> saep.—</sense><sense id="n24506.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24506.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Interval of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum regni,</quote> <trans><tr>an interregnum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine intervallo loquacitas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>incessant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor si longus, levis, dat enim intervalla,</quote> <trans><tr>relaxes sometimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum jam hos dies multos fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctio et aequalium et saepe variorum intervallorum numerum conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>; cf. the context. — </sense><sense id="n24506.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen aliis verborum volubilitasque cordi est: distincta alios et interpuncta intervalla, morae, respirationesque delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trochaeus temporibus et intervallis est par iambo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te tanto intervallo viderem,</quote> <trans><tr>after so long a time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem paululum attenuata crebris intervallis et divisionibus oportet uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto ex intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallo dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>after a pause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66</bibl></cit>: ex intervallo, <hi rend="ital">farther on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower down</hi> (in the discourse), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine intervallo cibum dare,</quote> <trans><tr>without loss of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: dare quippiam alicui per intervalla, <hi rend="ital">at intervals</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">from time to time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 66, § 164</bibl> (al. intervalla dantur): <cit><quote lang="la">per intervallum adventantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <trans><tr>time for the perpetration of crimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24506.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videte, quantum intervallum sit interjectum inter majorum consilia, et istorum dementiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 15</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24506.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An interval</hi> in music, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n24506.8" n="inter-vectus," level="1"> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veho</etym>, <hi rend="ital">carried up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raised up</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:38" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n24506.9" n="inter-vello," level="1"> vulsi (rarely velli, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>vulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pick out here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24506.10" n="I" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to pluck out here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to thin.</hi>—Of wings: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego homo infelix fui qui non alas intervelli (sc. vocis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 170</bibl></cit>.—Of the beard: <cit><quote lang="la">isti, qui aut vellunt barbam, aut intervellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 20</bibl></cit>. — Of fruit and trees, <hi rend="ital">to pluck here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma intervelli melius est, ut quae relicta sint, grandescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 47, § 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24506.11" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to tear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num aliquid ex illis intervelli, atque ex tempore dicendis inseri possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ita sunt natura copulata, ut mutari aut intervelli sine confusione non possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervenio: <entryFree id="n24507" type="main" key="interve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, rarely <sense id="n24507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come in during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to intervene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi> (class.; syn. intercedo). </sense><sense id="n24507.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n24507.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsae pater intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin malo abscedas: ne interveneris, quaeso, dum resipiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verens ne molesti vobis interveniremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu Germani equites interveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Statius intervenit nonnullorum querelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">pro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid perperam fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 33</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24507.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n24507.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lie between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medius paries intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interveniente Ascanio lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interveniente flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 21, 35, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24507.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To interfere with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put a stop to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24507.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox proelio intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuationi sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verboque intervenit omni plangor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 708</bibl></cit>; so, of an oath in conversation: quoties lascivum intervenit illud,<cb n="INTE" />  etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 194</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24507.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (only in Tacitus): <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum diebus, qui cognitionem intervenerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24507.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24507.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take place meanwhile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among other things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla mihi res posthac potest jam intervenire tanta, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inter vos intervenerint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus exiguam dicit fortunam intervenire sapienti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus mirificus quidam intervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>has taken place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interveniunt motu stellarum grandines, imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervenit his cogitationibus avitum malum, regni cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24507.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stand in the way of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum bellum coeptis intervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberationi metum pro republica intervenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicum intervenientem flagellāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis vestro Deus intervenit amori?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24507.11" n="C" level="2"> Leg. t. t. </sense><sense id="n24507.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To interpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become surety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:3:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:17:section=15 al" default="NO">50, 1, 17, § 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24507.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To conduct a suit in another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:87" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 87</bibl>; cf. 4, 86 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro debitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 4:182" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24507.14" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To interfere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intermeddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exercise one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s authority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque senatu interveniente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor interveniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si interventum est casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi de improviso est interventum mulieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervenium: <entryFree id="n24508" type="main" key="interve_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vēnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vena</etym>, <sense id="n24508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space between the veins</hi>, in the earth, in stones, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interventio: <entryFree id="n24509" type="main" key="interventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intervenio</etym>, <sense id="n24509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a giving security</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:7:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 7, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interventor: <entryFree id="n24510" type="main" key="interventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24510.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who comes in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a visitor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuus ab interventoribus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24510.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bondsman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si filius fidejussor, vel quasi interventor acceptus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24510.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An intercessor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mediator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interventus: <entryFree id="n24511" type="main" key="interventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24511.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">interventus alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caleni et Calvenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomptini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 1, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24511.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">a coming between</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intervention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurrence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id proelium diremit nox interventu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis alicujus interventu arceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 12, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem interventu lunae occultari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interventu feriarum impediri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:26:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 26, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24511.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">interposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mediation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: principis, Trajan. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 18</bibl></cit>. —Esp., in a suit at law, <hi rend="ital">the substitution</hi> of a new plaintiff or defendant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:176" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
interversio: <entryFree id="n24512" type="main" key="interversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>interverto</etym>. <sense id="n24512.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An overthrowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frustrating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thwarting</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">praedicationis (Christi),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24512.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A purloining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzling</hi>: de interversione convictus, Cod. 10, 70, 12.</sense></entryFree>
interversor: <entryFree id="n24513" type="main" key="interversor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interversor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n24513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to turn hither and thither</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">interversando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24514" type="main" key="interversor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interversor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purloiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilferer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzler</hi> (post-class.), Cod. 10, 1, 8.</sense></entryFree>
interversura: <entryFree id="n24515" type="main" key="interversu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interversūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:de Limit. 178 al" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> de Limit. 178 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
interversus: <entryFree id="n24516" type="main" key="interversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">interversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from interverto.</entryFree>
interverto: <entryFree id="n24517" type="main" key="interverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw in another direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divert.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24517.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extremis partibus triglyphi semicanaliculi intervertantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductum aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:20:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24517.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi> for the worse, <hi rend="ital">pervert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recta ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 22:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to falsify accounts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24517.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To purloin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embezzle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille induxit, ut peteret: et receptum intervertit, ad seque transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interverso regali hoc dono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24517.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to cheat out of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defraud of</hi> a thing: aliquem aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defraud</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut me muliere intervorteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 110</bibl></cit>: possessione dominum,<cb n="INTE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 13</bibl>.— With <case>acc.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">quem intervortam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 20</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24517.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interversis patroni rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervibrans: <entryFree id="n24518" type="main" key="intervi_^brans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vī^brans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vibro], <sense id="n24518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">glittering among</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aethra intervibrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 586</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervigilo: <entryFree id="n24519" type="main" key="intervi^gi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vĭgĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to watch between whiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to awake now and then during sleep</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intervireo: <entryFree id="n24520" type="main" key="intervi^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vĭrĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. vireo</etym>, <sense id="n24520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be green here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be green between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 100</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of a snake: laetisque minax interviret herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:98" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
interviso: <entryFree id="n24521" type="main" key="intervi_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vīso</orth>, <itype>vīsi, vīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24521.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inspect secretly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc interviso jamne a portu advenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervisam, quid faciant coci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse crebro interviso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24521.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To visit from time to time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intervocaliter: <entryFree id="n24522" type="main" key="intervo_ca_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vōcālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loudly</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 231, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervolito: <entryFree id="n24523" type="hapax" key="intervo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intervŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n24523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. freq.</hi> [intervolo], <hi rend="ital">to fly about between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem imbrem ingens numerus avium intervolitando rapuisse fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervolo: <entryFree id="n24524" type="main" key="intervo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24524.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of birds, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24524.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille recens oculis intervolat Idmon,</quote> <trans><tr>flits before</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:27" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medias intervolat urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:614" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:539" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 539</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervomo: <entryFree id="n24525" type="main" key="intervo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inter-vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pour forth among</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aequor undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 894</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24525.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras hinc blasphemiae intervomunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intervorto: <entryFree id="n24526" type="main" key="intervorto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intervorto</orth>, v. interverto.</entryFree>
intervulsus: <entryFree id="n24527" type="main" key="intervulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intervulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intervello.</entryFree>
intestabilis: <entryFree id="n24528" type="main" key="intesta_bi^lis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-testābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is incapable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by reason of misconduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of being a witness or of making a will.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24528.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis ob carmen famosum damnetur, senatusconsulto expressum est, ut intestabilis sit, ergo nec testamentum facere poterit, nec ad testamentum adhiberi testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24528.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24528.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execrable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestabilis et sacer esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 41, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— </sense><sense id="n24528.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">ars magica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24529" type="main" key="intesta_bi^lis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intestābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>in-, 2. testis</etym>, = 2. intestatus; <sense id="n24529.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in double sense with 1. intestabilis, II. A.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 1, 24</bibl> (cf. Lorenz ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
intestato: <entryFree id="n24530" type="main" key="intesta_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intestātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. intestātus <sense id="n24530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intestatus: <entryFree id="n24531" type="main" key="intesta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-testātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24531.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That has made no will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si intestata esset mortua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>: cives, Trajan. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam si intestatus eas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:274" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:64" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24531.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not convicted by witnesses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indemnatus atque intestatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24531.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Not trustworthy</hi>: servus, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 323, 28</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n24531.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestā-ta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who has not made a will</hi>: virgo vestalis neque heres est cuiquam intestato neque intestatae quisquam, Lab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> 3, 1</bibl> sqq.; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 16, 3; 1 sq.—</sense><sense id="n24531.4" n="B" level="2"> As <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestātō</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ab intestātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterfamilias cum mortuus esset intestato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab intestato heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:7:1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 7, 1, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:6:section=1" default="NO">5, 2, 6, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:93 al" default="NO">29, 2, 93 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24532" type="main" key="intesta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-testātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <etym>2. testis</etym>, <sense id="n24532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emasculated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si intestatus non abeo hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intestina: <entryFree id="n24533" type="main" key="intesti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. intestinus.</entryFree>
intestinarius: <entryFree id="n24534" type="main" key="intesti_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intestinus</etym>, <sense id="n24534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that does inlaid work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fine joiner</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s work</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">FABER,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4182</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24534.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a joiner</hi>, Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
intestinus: <entryFree id="n24535" type="main" key="intesti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intus</etym>, <sense id="n24535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestine</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24535.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: neque <pb n="988" /> <cb n="INTI" /> ut quidquam interesset inter intestinum et oblatum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultum, intestinum ac domesticum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ham. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5</bibl></cit>: opus, <hi rend="ital">inlaid work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine joiner</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s work</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa opere tectorio et intestino spectanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 42, 82, § 225</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24535.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a gut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the guts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intestines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrails</hi> in the abdomen (whereas exta denotes the entrails or large viscera contained in the thorax). </sense><sense id="n24535.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n24535.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loto terram ferit intestino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:429" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 429</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 16 al.</bibl>—Also, <gen>m.</gen>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (sc. canalis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 78, § 199</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24535.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquiae cibi depelluntur, tum adstringentibus se intestinis, tum relaxantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborare ex intestinis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be disordered in the bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capiunt plus intestina poetae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 78</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24535.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: intestinum medium, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">mesente/rion,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the mesentery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:N. D. 2:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestinum tenuius, crassius, jejunum, caecum, rectum,</quote> <trans><tr>the straight gut</tr>, <tr>rectum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imum,</quote> <trans><tr>rectum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24535.7" n="C" level="2"> Sine ornamentis, cum intestinis omnibus (amicam vendere), i. e. <hi rend="ital">naked</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 109</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. heterocl.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 54</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intestīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:76:11" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 76, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intestis: <entryFree id="n24536" type="main" key="intestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-testis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-, 2. testis</etym>, <sense id="n24536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without testicles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emasculated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 160</bibl> (cf. Salmas ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
intexo: <entryFree id="n24537" type="main" key="intexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-texo</orth>, <itype>texŭi, textum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weave into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to inweave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interweave; to plait</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interlace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24537.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureasque notas filis intexuit albis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversos colores picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitibus ulmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus intexto Phrygiis spectabilis auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 166</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum chlamyde purpurea variis coloribus intexta,</quote> <trans><tr>embroidered</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intextus puer regius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 252</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae intexere truncos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24537.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to weave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make by weaving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interlacing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus intextum tauris opus,</quote> <trans><tr>of hides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterili junco cannaque intexta palustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex lino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latera intextus stellatis axibus agger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:109" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24537.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: facta chartis, <hi rend="ital">to interweave on paper</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to describe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva magnis, laeta tristibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in causa prudenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: tali te vellem ritu inter soles ... naturae rerum magnis intexere chartis, <hi rend="ital">to interweave in a poem on nature your fame</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intextio: <entryFree id="n24538" type="main" key="intexti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intextĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intexo</etym>, <sense id="n24538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a weaving together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, 23, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intextus: <entryFree id="n24539" type="main" key="intextus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intexo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24540" type="main" key="intextus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intextus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intexo</etym>, <sense id="n24540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an interweaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joining together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 30</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 8</bibl>, contextu is the true reading).</sense></entryFree>
inthronizo: <entryFree id="n24541" type="main" key="inthro^nizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-thrŏnizo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>thronus</etym>, <sense id="n24541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enthrone</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intibaceus: <entryFree id="n24542" type="main" key="inti^ba_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭbācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intibus</etym>, <sense id="n24542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to endive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endive-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 82, § 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intibili: <entryFree id="n24543" type="main" key="Intibili"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Intibili</orth>, <sense id="n24543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the farther side of the Ebro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at its mouth</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre del Sol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 49, 12</bibl>; the same, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Indibile</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
intibus: <entryFree id="n24544" type="main" key="inti^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭbus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">intybus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭbus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> or <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭbum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">intybum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e)/ntubon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n24544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">endive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succory</hi> (Cichorium, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 29, § 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intiba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 120</bibl>: edere acres intibos, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 209, 4</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 128 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">torpenti grata palato intyba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:110" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intimatio: <entryFree id="n24545" type="main" key="inti^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intimo</etym>, <sense id="n24545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an announcement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declaration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 897</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intimator: <entryFree id="n24546" type="main" key="inti^ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who announces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">publishes</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intime: <entryFree id="n24547" type="main" key="inti^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intimus <sense id="n24547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intimide: <entryFree id="n24548" type="main" key="inti^mi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĭmĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n24548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearlessly;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intimidius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intimo: <entryFree id="n24549" type="main" key="inti^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>intimus</etym>, <sense id="n24549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="INTO" /> <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring into</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24549.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem gurgiti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus mari intimatur,</quote> <trans><tr>flows into</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum tabulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 5</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24549.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24549.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem aliquam inbibere et sibi intimare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:33" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 33</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n24549.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To announce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntius intimatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 3, 8</bibl>: vitam litteris, Treb. Gall. 16: notoriā tuā intimāsti, Claudium graviter irasci, Gall. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctis pistoribus intimari oportet, quod si quis, etc., Cod. 14, 3, 1: longitudines syllabarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, § 519</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intimorate: <entryFree id="n24550" type="hapax" key="inti^mo_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmōrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. in-timor</etym>, <sense id="n24550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, Vet. Interpr. Iren. 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
intimus: <entryFree id="n24551" type="main" key="inti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n24551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. sup.</hi> [in-ter; cf. interior], <hi rend="ital">inmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">innermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most profound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most intimate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">traxit ex intimo ventre suspirium,</quote> <trans><tr>from the deepest part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo sacrario intimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbis intimam partem venisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 37</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">96: abdidit se in intimam Macedoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 177</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24551.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24551.3" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n24551.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Profound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deepest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inmost</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex intima philosophia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>soliloquy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:53:179" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 53, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24551.5" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">intimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex meis intimis familiaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intimi ipsius amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter intimos amicos habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis quam intimum habeam te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me fuisse huic fateor intimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere se intimum apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24551.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a most intimate friend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus ex meis familiarissimis atque intimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. 3, 1, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex intimis regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intimi amicorum Vitellii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n24551.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inmost parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:47:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 47, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalpuntur intima versu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">se in intimum conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 62</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭmē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the inmost part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally; most intimately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most cordially</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most strongly</hi> (class. only in the trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n24551.8" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uri intime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 24, 41</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24551.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utebatur intime Q. Hortensio,</quote> <trans><tr>was on terms of close intimacy with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intime commendari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intinctio: <entryFree id="n24552" type="main" key="intincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intingo</etym>, <sense id="n24552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dipping in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a baptizing</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poenit. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intinctus: <entryFree id="n24553" type="main" key="intinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of intingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24554" type="main" key="intinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intingo</etym>, <sense id="n24554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dipping in;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a sauce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pickle</hi> in which meat, etc., is dipped, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:81" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 33, § 81</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 29, 35, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intingo: <entryFree id="n24555" type="main" key="intingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tingo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tinguo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tinguo</etym>, <sense id="n24555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dip in.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24555.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam in acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buccas rubricā cerā omne corpus intinxti tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces in fossa sanguinis atra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad intinguntur calami, morantur manum (in writing on parchment),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24555.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24555.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dip in sauce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pickle; to pickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus, quae condiuntur, quaeque intinguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 72, § 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24555.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To baptize</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poenit. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
intitubabilis: <entryFree id="n24556" type="main" key="inti^tu^ba_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intĭtŭbābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-titubo</etym>, <sense id="n24556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwavering</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 134, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intitulo: <entryFree id="n24557" type="main" key="inti^tu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tĭtŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entitle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give a name to</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Invect. in Hier. 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intolerabilis: <entryFree id="n24558" type="main" key="into^le^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏlĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24558.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot bear</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi> (ante-class.): didicisset id ferre, et non esset intolerabilis, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 125, 25</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 255 Rib.). — </sense><sense id="n24558.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insupportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45</bibl></cit>: dolor, <cb n="INTO" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regium nomen Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelius arrogantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:413" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 413</bibl></cit>: injuria, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 3, 3, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo intolerabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerabilius nihil est quam femina dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:460" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 460</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24558.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Irresistible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32, 8</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">insupportably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intolerabilitas: <entryFree id="n24559" type="gloss" key="into^le^ra_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕrābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intolerabilis</etym>, <sense id="n24559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insupportableness</hi>: intolerabilitas, <foreign lang="greek">a)nupoisto/ths,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
