intolerabiliter: <entryFree id="n24560" type="main" key="into^le^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intolerabilis <sense id="n24560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intolerandus: <entryFree id="n24561" type="main" key="into^le^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏlĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">insupportable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi> (class): <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: anxitudo, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 33</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 164 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:35:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 35, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam longi itineris labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominatio nobilitati plebique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕrandum</orth>, <itype>adverbially</itype>, <hi rend="ital">insupportably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerandum fervit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intolerans: <entryFree id="n24562" type="main" key="into^le^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏlĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24562.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">endure</hi> a thing (syn. impatiens), <hi rend="ital">impatient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerant</hi> (not anteAug.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundarum rerum nemo intolerantior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora intolerantissima laboris atque aestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 80</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24562.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, = intolerandus, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insufferable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intolerable</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): curae, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingens gloriā, atque eo ferocior, et subjectis intolerantior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil insultatione barbarorum intolerantius fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:36" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 36</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intolerably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immoderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excessively</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerantius insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se jactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerantissime gloriari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 12, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intolerantia: <entryFree id="n24563" type="main" key="into^le^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŏlĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intolerans</etym>. <sense id="n24563.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impatience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intolerantia, cum injurias, quae sunt ferendae, non toleramus, neque ferimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24563.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24563.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unendurableness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24563.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., of conduct, <hi rend="ital">insufferableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insolence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia atque intolerantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intoleratus: <entryFree id="n24564" type="main" key="into^le^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not nourished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refreshed by food</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:124" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intolero: <entryFree id="n24565" type="main" key="into^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏlĕro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take ill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerat, intolerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intollo: <entryFree id="n24566" type="main" key="intollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tollo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">clamores absonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intondeo: <entryFree id="n24567" type="main" key="intonde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tondĕo</orth>, <itype>tondi, tonsum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clip off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibrarum summas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intono: <entryFree id="n24568" type="main" key="into^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (āvi), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thunder</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24568.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">partibus intonuit caeli Pater ipse sinistris, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106: cum deus intonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonuere poli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater omnipotens ter intonuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 142</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 361: deus majestatis intonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 28, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonuit laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 542</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24568.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et clipeum super intonat ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 709</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concussa arma intonuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:213" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus praecipue servus tam valde intonuit, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti latratu canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus Intonat Aegaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:365" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24568.3" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to bring down with a thundering sound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavam superne intonat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:169" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 169</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Eois intonata fluctibus hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:51" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24568.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cry out vehemently; to thunder forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hesternā contione intonuit vox perniciosa tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 38, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurgit atque intonat ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intonet horrendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:485" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 485</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum haec intonuisset plenus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae intonuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 515</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 267</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: (Fortuna) simul intonuit, proxima<pb n="989" /> <cb n="INTR" />  quaeque fugat, <hi rend="ital">has threatened</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:298" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intonsus: <entryFree id="n24569" type="main" key="intonsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intondeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24570" type="main" key="intonsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-tondeo</etym>, <sense id="n24570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshorn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24570.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: scindens dolore identidem intonsam comam, Acc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4,38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 52: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:5" default="NO">4, 13, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:655" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not yet shaved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanique comas intonsa juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:674" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 674</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24570.2" n="B. " level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: montes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">leafy</hi> (covered with grass, herbs, or bushes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus intonsaque caelo Attollunt capita,</quote> <trans><tr>leafy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of the old Romans, who neither cut their hair nor shaved their beards: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsores in Italiam venere post Romam conditam anno CCCCLIV., antea intonsi fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 59, 59, § 211</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Hor. C. 2, 15, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avi,</quote> <trans><tr>bearded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24570.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unpolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines intonsi et inculti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Getae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intorpeo: <entryFree id="n24571" type="main" key="intorpe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-torpĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be very stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpet, intorpet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intorqueo: <entryFree id="n24572" type="main" key="intorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>torsi, tortum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn to; to wrench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprain</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24572.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentum in dicendo,</quote> <trans><tr>to distort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 114</bibl></cit>: talum, <hi rend="ital">to sprain</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 38: vereor, ne Pompeio quid oneris imponam, <foreign lang="greek">mh/ moi *gorgei/hn kefalh\n deinoi=o pelw/rou</foreign> intorqueat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to twist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrap itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">involvulus, quae in pampini folio intorta implicat se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum subito ... procella nubibus intorsit sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi palmites intorquentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24572.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24572.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To brandish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">throw towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam tergo,</quote> <trans><tr>to launch at its back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurl against one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 322</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:304" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 304</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:623" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 882</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 45" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 45</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24572.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw into confusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <trans><tr>to corrupt</tr>, <tr>pervert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:38" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24572.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw out against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alternis versibus intorquentur inter fratres gravissimae contumeliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem diram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 342</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">intortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">twisted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wound; crisped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curled; trailed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolonged; perplexed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involved; distorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirae modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 23, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intorto circa bracchium pallio,</quote> <trans><tr>wound about my arm</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludamentum,</quote> <trans><tr>wrapped round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues intorti capillis Eumenidum,</quote> <trans><tr>entwined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <trans><tr>curled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:284" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 284</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus concisus, intortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctuae intorto carmine occinunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudentes,</quote> <trans><tr>twisted</tr>, <tr>made by twisting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:679 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 679 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intortē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">windingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crookedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intortius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: hoc dicere, August. de Nat. et <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intortio: <entryFree id="n24573" type="main" key="intorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n24573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a curling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crisping</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capillorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intortus: <entryFree id="n24574" type="main" key="intortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from intorqueo, q. v. <sense id="n24574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intra: <entryFree id="n24575" type="main" key="intra_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrā</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>contr. from intĕrā; sc. parte</etym>, <sense id="n24575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi> (class. only as a <pos>prep.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n24575.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24575.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadraginta per oram, intra centum erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars, quae intra, longior esse debet, quam quae extra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inciditur, viridis intra caro apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa extrinsecus, et intra diligenter picata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 43, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24575.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n24575.4" n="1" level="3"> Of the interior of countries: intra vix jam homines magisque semiferi, Mela, 1, 4, 4.—</sense><sense id="n24575.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the interior of a building: <cit><quote lang="la">pro rostris aurata aedes ... intraque lectus eburneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra forisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24575.6" n="3" level="3"> Of the Mediterranean Sea, Mela, prooem. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">abunde orbe terrae extra intra indicato (opp. extra, of the ocean),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 32, 38, § 205 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n24575.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards the inside</hi> (rare): binos interim digitos distinguimus ... paulum tamen inferioribus intra spectantibus, Quint. <cb n="INTR" /> 11, 3, 98.—</sense><sense id="n24575.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (placed after its noun: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturam intra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 75</bibl></cit>, and: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem intra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">within.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24575.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place: <cit><quote lang="la">intra navim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra parietes meos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceres stare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: jactum teli, <hi rend="ital">within a javelin</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s throw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 608</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem Taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus intra oceanum jam, nullus est, quo non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea intra se consumunt Arabes,</quote> <trans><tr>consume among themselves</tr>, <tr>in their own country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 99</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Devoravi nomen inprudens modo. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Non placet qui amicos intra dentis conclusos habet, <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 64</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter dentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit> Brix.—</sense><sense id="n24575.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24575.11" n="1" level="3"> I. q. <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea intra pectus se penetravit potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosse regiones, intra quas venere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui intra fines suos Ariovistum recepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra moenia compulsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24575.12" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the course of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in less than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra viginti dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui intra annos quatuordecim tectum non subiissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae intra decem annos facta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 37</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">B. and K. inter): intra paucos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra breve tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventam,</quote> <trans><tr>in youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 71</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> ( = postquam): <cit><quote lang="la">intra decimum diem quam Pheras venerat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>before the lapse of ten days after his arrival</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n24575.13" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24575.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">below</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">less than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fewer than</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within the limits of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulari intra legem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>less expensively than the law allows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra modum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra verba desipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to betray insanity in words only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra verba peccare,</quote> <trans><tr>to transgress in words only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra gloriam fuit facinus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>was not inglorious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra silentium se tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra famam sunt scripta,</quote> <trans><tr>beneath his reputation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24575.15" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24575.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Intra se, <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditantes intra semet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra se dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra se componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24575.17" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra vos futura,</quote> <trans><tr>shall remain among yourselves</tr>, <tr>be kept secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intrabilis: <entryFree id="n24576" type="main" key="intra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intro</etym>, <sense id="n24576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be entered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ōs amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intraclusus: <entryFree id="n24577" type="main" key="intra_clu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrā-clūsus</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">intra clusus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, <sense id="n24577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shut in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclosed</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> Urb. de Limit. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intractabilis: <entryFree id="n24578" type="main" key="intracta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tractābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not to be handled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meddled with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmanageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intractable; rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi> (since the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus intractabile bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 339</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo naturā intractabilior et morosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanim. and abstr. things: pastinacae virus intractabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca frigore,</quote> <trans><tr>uninhabitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intractabilis et dura aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intractatus: <entryFree id="n24579" type="main" key="intracta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tractātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-tracto</etym>, <sense id="n24579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not handled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">managed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untamed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild; untried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unattempted</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>unbroken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decor,</quote> <trans><tr>wild</tr>, <tr>natural</tr>, <tr>simple</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <trans><tr>not carded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:57" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid intractatum scelerisve dolive fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intractio: <entryFree id="n24580" type="main" key="intracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intraho</etym>, <sense id="n24580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dragging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae (al. contractio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intraho: <entryFree id="n24581" type="main" key="intra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trăho</orth>, <itype>traxi, tractum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n24581.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drag along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to trail</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24581.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw on</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesperam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 268, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24581.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To throw abuse upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>: intrahere est contumeliam intorquere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=111" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 111</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
intrameatus: <entryFree id="n24582" type="gloss" key="intra_me^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrā-mĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">intrōm-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n24582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">within</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meatus, intrameatus, intromeatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intramuranus: <entryFree id="n24583" type="main" key="intra_mu_ra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrā-mūrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>murus</etym>, <sense id="n24583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is within the walls</hi> (post-class.): magistratus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">within the city of Rome</hi>, Ps.Ascon. ap. Verr. 2, 2, 6, § <cit><quote lang="la">17: spatia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 7, 5</bibl></cit>. <cb n="INTR" /></sense></entryFree>
intraneus: <entryFree id="n24584" type="main" key="intra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intra</etym>, <sense id="n24584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inner</hi> (opp. extraneus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intransgressibilis: <entryFree id="n24585" type="main" key="intransgressi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-transgressĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot be crossed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpassed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transferred</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intransibilis: <entryFree id="n24586" type="main" key="intransi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intransĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-transeo</etym>, <sense id="n24586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impassable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 4, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intransitive: <entryFree id="n24587" type="main" key="intransi^ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intransĭtīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intransitivus <sense id="n24587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intransitivus: <entryFree id="n24588" type="main" key="intransi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intransĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. intranseo</etym>, gram. t. t., <sense id="n24588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intransitive</hi>, i. e. that does not pass over to another person, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 982</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intransĭtīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intransitively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1134</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
intransmeabilis: <entryFree id="n24589" type="main" key="intransme^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-transmĕābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">impassable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">chaos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 1</bibl>: oceanus, Jorn. Reb. Get. 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
intremisco: <entryFree id="n24590" type="main" key="intre^misco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕmisco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [intremo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to tremble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quake</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">insidiarum metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu intremiscente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
intremo: <entryFree id="n24591" type="main" key="intre^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trĕmo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24591.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus intremit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem Murmure Trinacriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 581</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intremuit malus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 505</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:629" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua intremuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:458" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 458</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 180: quo (clamore) intremuere undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 672</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24591.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tremble at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">before</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:60" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 664</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intremulus: <entryFree id="n24592" type="main" key="intre^mu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>intremo</etym>, <sense id="n24592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tremulous</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 34, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24593" type="main" key="intre^mu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not tremulous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intrepidans: <entryFree id="n24594" type="gloss" key="intre^pi^dans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕpĭdans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-trepido</etym>, <sense id="n24594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> (post-class.), Inscr. ap. Paulovich. Marm. Macarens. p. 61.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕpĭdan-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 530, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intrepide: <entryFree id="n24595" type="main" key="intre^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. intrepidus.</entryFree>
intrepido: <entryFree id="n24596" type="main" key="intre^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trĕpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perform tremblingly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidly</hi> (postclass.): multos orbes, Symm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Jornand.</author> de Reb. Get. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intrepidus: <entryFree id="n24597" type="main" key="intre^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unshaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undaunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepid</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n24597.1" n="I" level="1"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">intrepidus minantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucae bestiarum in hostem actae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 33, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillus, intrepidus, immobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor discrimine nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:503" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova nupta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 76, p. 323, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis et intrepidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Met. 4, p. 171, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac paratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl>, ext. 3; Plin. praef. § 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaecumque altaria tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:89 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 89 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 317</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24597.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio,</quote> <trans><tr>that drives away fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 593" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spent in quiet winter-quarters</tr>, <tr>without disturbance from enemies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĕpĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without trembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undauntedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrepidly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 33, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intribulatus: <entryFree id="n24598" type="main" key="intri^bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĭbŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. in-tribulo</etym>, <sense id="n24598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pressed out</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intribuo: <entryFree id="n24599" type="main" key="intri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to contribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pay tribute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taxes</hi> (post-Aug.): modo ne quid intribuant, Trajan. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intributio: <entryFree id="n24600" type="main" key="intri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>intribuo</etym>, <sense id="n24600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contribution</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab intributionibus excusari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:18:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii intributionibus fungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:22" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
intricatus: <entryFree id="n24601" type="main" key="intri_ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrīcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, from intrico.</entryFree>
intrico: <entryFree id="n24602" type="main" key="intri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trīco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. in-tricor</etym>, <sense id="n24602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to entangle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embarrass</hi> (mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24602.1" n="I" level="1"> Of persons: Chrysippus intricatur hoc modo, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenonem intricatum dabo,</quote> <trans><tr>will entangle</tr>, <tr>embarrass him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24602.2" n="II" level="1"> Of things: ita intricavit hanc rem temeritas, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intrimentum: <entryFree id="n24603" type="hapax" key="intri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>intero</etym>, <sense id="n24603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is rubbed in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seasoning made of ingredients rubbed in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 31</bibl>. <pb n="990" /> <cb n="INTR" /></sense></entryFree>
intrinsecus: <entryFree id="n24604" type="main" key="intrinse^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrinsĕcus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>intra-secus</etym>, <sense id="n24604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwardly</hi> (mostly ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eam intrinsecus eādem re perinungunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudabant fauces, intrinsecus atrae, sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrinsecus cavum, extrinsecus gibberum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. exterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 44, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:6" default="NO">8, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24604.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Towards the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">replicata jocinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 73, § 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:95" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24605" type="main" key="intrinse^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrinsĕcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inward</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumina cordis intrinseca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 118, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intrita: <entryFree id="n24606" type="main" key="intri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. <itype>intero</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
intritus: <entryFree id="n24607" type="main" key="intri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. intero <sense id="n24607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24608" type="main" key="intri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not rubbed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worn away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24608.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 49, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24608.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">not worn out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not exhausted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes intritae ab labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intro: <entryFree id="n24609" type="main" key="intro_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from interō sc. loco</etym>. <sense id="n24609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">internally; on the inside</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sana faciet, intro quae dolitabunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24609.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sequere intro me, amabo,</quote> <trans><tr>into the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro ad nos venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro advenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro est itum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ad nos filiam tuam non intro vocari jubes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam intro vocarentur ad suffragium tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">intro vocata centuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24610" type="main" key="intro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (intrassis for intraveris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 63</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. intro</etym>, <sense id="n24610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">walk into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> (syn.: ingredior, introeo). </sense><sense id="n24610.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24610.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.; constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n24610.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ingredi illam domum ausus es? tu illud sanctissimum limen intrare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomoerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dat. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:5" default="NO">4, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:59" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 110:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 110, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">januam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum et flammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis intrans aequora,</quote> <trans><tr>emptying into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notus medullas intravit calor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis ripas,</quote> <trans><tr>to come between</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24610.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante quam (animus) in corpus intravisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 15, 20, § 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intravit in hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:492" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24610.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montibus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:590" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneribus mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:550" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 550</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 289</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24610.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">intra</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">intra praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus ad Alexandrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 19</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24610.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n24610.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force a way into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo qui intraverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intravere eo arma Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quo loco nostri intrare possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hostes intrare ad se possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 79" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad munimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (opp. abeuntes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:28:8" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus vultum intrantes tristem, abeuntes hilarum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mare intretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo non modo intrari, sed ne perspici quidem possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24610.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To appear before</hi> court: <cit><quote lang="la">alio senatu Vicetini sine advocato intraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 31, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24610.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To attack</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:774" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 774</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24610.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:27:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intravit torvum Gortynia lumen harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:447" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 447</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 147</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24610.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to penetrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierce into</hi> (class.); constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla acies humani ingenii tanta est, quae penetrare in caelum, terram intrare possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rerum naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sensum et in mentem judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47, 204</bibl>: <cb n="INTR" /> penitus in alicujus familiaritatem, <hi rend="ital">to become one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s intimate friend</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Helv. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> ad Helv. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus quam nec honor nec gratia intrare posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vatem Deus,</quote> <trans><tr>inspires</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:697" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 697</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum militaris gloriae cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidos intrat metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intravit animos pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:124" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 124</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius accedo ... intrabo etiam magis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introcedo: <entryFree id="n24611" type="main" key="intro_ce_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">post opimas dapes quidam introcessit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 160, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 254, 3.</sense></entryFree>
introcludo: <entryFree id="n24612" type="gloss" key="intro_clu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-clūdo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, for intracludo, <sense id="n24612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shut up in</hi>: introcludo, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkataklei/w,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
introcurro: <entryFree id="n24613" type="hapax" key="intro_curro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-curro</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run in</hi>: per fretum, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 27</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 59 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
introduco: <entryFree id="n24614" type="main" key="intro_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-dūco</orth>, <itype>duxi, ductum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring into</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">to conduct into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">within</hi> (syn.: induco, immitto). </sense><sense id="n24614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24614.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gregem venalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volturcium cum legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod oppidum cohortibus introductis tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24614.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si suas copias Aedui in fines Bellovacorum introduxerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationes in senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in senatum aliquem ad agendas gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium in urbem Chium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24614.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 17</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24614.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">eo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nacti portum, eo naves introduxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24614.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24614.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam in domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionem in senatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to introduce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 5, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24614.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in speaking or writing, <hi rend="ital">to introduce a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonem senem disputantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictam narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pictores animas sensibus auctas,</quote> <trans><tr>represented</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 630</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24614.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring forward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo natum mundum introduxit, sed etiam paene manu factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
