D. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">introducebat, summum bonum esse, frui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:19 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 19 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n24614.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To institute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hujus modi principio consuetudo aestimationis introducta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac introducta consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi deliberationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum in republica exemplum,</quote> <trans><tr>to set an example</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum a patricio homine introductum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges perniciosissimas reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus novos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novas superstitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introductio: <entryFree id="n24615" type="main" key="intro_ducti_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōductīo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>introduco</etym>, <sense id="n24615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leading in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulorum nobilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculi,</quote> <trans><tr>a beginning</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introductor: <entryFree id="n24616" type="main" key="intro_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an introducer</hi>, Ruf. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introductorius: <entryFree id="n24617" type="main" key="intro_ducto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōductōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>introductor</etym>, <sense id="n24617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">introductory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introductus: <entryFree id="n24618" type="main" key="intro_ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from introduco.</entryFree>
introeo: <entryFree id="n24619" type="main" key="introe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intro-ĕo</orth> (ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">introdeo</orth>; <sense id="n24619.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">introiet for introibit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Lucifer. 5</bibl></cit>), īvi, or <itype>ĭi, ĭtum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to go in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> (syn.: intro, ingredior); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24619.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24619.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereri introdire in alienam domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Thraciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24619.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti salutatum introire ad Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24619.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bithyniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24619.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (ante-class.): in naso, <cb n="INTR" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius introiit videre, quid agat,</quote> <trans><tr>went in to see</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">huc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum periculo introitur recenti apertione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: castra sine vulnere introitum, <hi rend="ital">entered</hi>, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 628</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24619.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem fuerat aequius, ut prius introieram, sic prius exire de vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introfero: <entryFree id="n24620" type="main" key="intro_fe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum, ferre</itype>, <sense id="n24620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. anom. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā in urbem introferri solitus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā est introlatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introgredior: <entryFree id="n24621" type="main" key="intro_gre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-grĕdĭor</orth>, <itype>essus sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>gradior</etym>, <sense id="n24621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to step</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">introgressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 520</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introitorius: <entryFree id="n24622" type="gloss" key="intro^i^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrŏĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. intrŏī tus</etym>, <sense id="n24622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to entry</hi>: introitorius, <foreign lang="greek">ei)so/dios,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
introitus: <entryFree id="n24623" type="main" key="intro^i^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrŏĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from introeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24624" type="main" key="intro^i^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrŏĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>introeo</etym>, <sense id="n24624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an entering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24624.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnus introitus Zmyrnam quasi in hostium urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol in Geminos introitum facit,</quote> <trans><tr>enters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo statim introitu,</quote> <trans><tr>at his very first entrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem introitu prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">introitum alicujus rei pellere,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep a thing from entering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 101</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sol introitum in Cancro facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:49" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24624.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the mouth</hi> of a river, <hi rend="ital">its entrance into another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:398" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 398</bibl></cit>; also as <hi rend="ital">the entrance to it</hi> from the sea (cf. B. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">Indi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:41 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 25, § 41 al.</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n24624.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place of entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnes introitus, qua adiri poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes introitus erant praeclusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clandestinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures duros et quasi corneolos habere introitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsum introitum exspectare macelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 10</bibl></cit>. —In the <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">INTROITO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2103</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24624.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24624.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An entering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrance</hi> upon an office or into a society: <cit><quote lang="la">certum aliquid pro introitu dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiam illam cum introitu comparari volo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>entrancemoney</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 102</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24624.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A beginning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">introduction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prelude</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">principium, exordium, prooemium): fabulae Clodianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in introitu hujus operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introjugus: <entryFree id="n24625" type="main" key="intro_ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the yoke</hi>: tres equi, Inscr. ap. Grut. 337.</sense></entryFree>
introlatus: <entryFree id="n24626" type="main" key="intro_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from introfero.</entryFree>
intromissus: <entryFree id="n24627" type="main" key="intro_missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from intromitto.</entryFree>
intromitto: <entryFree id="n24628" type="main" key="intro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n24628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> intromittier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 53</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to send in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> (syn. induco, immitto; class.). </sense><sense id="n24628.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepores in leporarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones (sc. in oppidum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caninium legatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 35" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Hisp. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum bestiis in harenam intromissi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">two acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex milia peditum Nolam intromisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquam ad vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Senecam aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 61</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaedriam comissatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24628.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba in usum linguae Latinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: controversiam (<foreign lang="greek">ei)sa/gesqai di/khn</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intropono: <entryFree id="n24629" type="gloss" key="intro_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-pōno</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put in</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introporto: <entryFree id="n24630" type="gloss" key="intro_porto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-porto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring in</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introrepo: <entryFree id="n24631" type="main" key="intro_re_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-rēpo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">introrepens mustela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl>, p. 125, 19.</sense></entryFree>
introrsum: <entryFree id="n24632" type="main" key="introrsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">introrsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">introrsus</orth> (access. form INTROSVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4034</bibl>; v. also introversus), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from intro versum</etym>. <sense id="n24632.0" n="I" level="1"> Form introrsum. </sense><sense id="n24632.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Towards the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem introrsum in media castra accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24632.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the inside</hi>: sed <pb n="991" /> <cb n="INTU" /> videt hunc omnis domus Introrsum turpem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24632.3" n="II" level="1"> Form introrsus. </sense><sense id="n24632.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non facile Introrsus perspici posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24632.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Inwardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris nitent, introrsus misera sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae obortae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 539</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introrumpo: <entryFree id="n24633" type="main" key="intro_rumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-rumpo</orth>, <itype>rūpi, ruptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to break in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter by force</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ea non posse introrumpere videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerva in cubiculum Sertorii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:22:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 22, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introspecto: <entryFree id="n24634" type="main" key="intro_specto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōspecto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n24634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [introspicio], <hi rend="ital">to look into</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid introspectant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introspector: <entryFree id="n24635" type="hapax" key="intro_spector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who looks into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inspector</hi>, August.</sense></entryFree>
introspicio: <entryFree id="n24636" type="main" key="intro_spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>spexi, spectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>specio</etym>, <sense id="n24636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">look at</hi> (syn. inspicio). </sense><sense id="n24636.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24636.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To look into</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:15:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 15, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casas omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:51:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 51, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24636.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To look at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum felicitatem aegris oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24636.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe attentively;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or simple <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n24636.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">introspicite penitus in omnes rei publicae partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mentem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24636.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus introspicite Catilinae, Cethegi, ceterorumque mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinum religiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non introspectis penitus virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:75" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introtrudo: <entryFree id="n24637" type="main" key="intro_tru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-trūdo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust in</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">turundam introtrudito (al. intro trudito),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introvenio: <entryFree id="n24638" type="hapax" key="intro_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to come in</hi>, trop., Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> de Prodig. 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
introversus: <entryFree id="n24639" type="main" key="intro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-versus</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō versus</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> for introrsus, <sense id="n24639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">towards the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inwards</hi> (ante-class.): introversus, et ad te Spectant, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 402, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectantia genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se proicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introvocatus: <entryFree id="n24640" type="main" key="intro_vo^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrōvŏcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>introvoco</etym>, <sense id="n24640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling in</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">primo introvocatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
introvoco: <entryFree id="n24641" type="main" key="intro_vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intrō-vŏco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit> (more correctly intro vocari, as in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 18</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
intrudo: <entryFree id="n24642" type="main" key="intru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-trūdo</orth>, <itype>trūsi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">force in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipse inferebat et intrudebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 5, 13</bibl></cit> B. and K. (dub.; Klotz, intro dabat; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 620).</sense></entryFree>
intubus: <entryFree id="n24643" type="main" key="intu^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭbus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">intŭbum</orth>, v. intibus, etc.</entryFree>
intueor: <entryFree id="n24644" type="main" key="intu^e^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŭĕor</orth>, <itype>ĭtus, 2</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (in tmesi: <sense id="n24644.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">inque tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 713</bibl></cit>; archaic form indo tuetur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 18</bibl> = Ann. 73 Vahl.; <cit><quote lang="la">and intuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 23</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 898" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 898</bibl>, and in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39, 5</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to look at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">towards</hi> (syn.: adspicio, contemplor, specto). </sense><sense id="n24644.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. with simple <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n24644.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram intuens modeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intueor et contemplor unumquemque vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc atque illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: lasciviam piscium, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnes intueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora omnium atque oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid, ut noverca, me intueris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutum illius diligenter,</quote> <trans><tr>to watch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of situation: cubiculum montes intuentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24644.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in speciem rerum intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in te intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24644.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24644.5" n="A" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to regard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemplate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give attention to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24644.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut tota mente Crassum atque omni animo intueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intentis oculis omnes rei publicae partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem eorum qui audiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentis acies seipsam intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 156</bibl></cit>: potius, quid se facere par esset, intuebatur, quam <cb n="INTU" /> quid alii laudaturi forent. <hi rend="ital">he regarded more</hi>, <hi rend="ital">had more respect for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:35 al" default="NO">3, 8, 35 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatem impendentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ille intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 1</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">pass. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intuendum quid affectet quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam veteranos intuendos nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24644.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo intuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24644.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summos homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu in tuā mtuens te continebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquod majus malum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24644.9" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad finiendum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24644.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to regard with admiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonder at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci sic te intuebuntur, ut quendam ex annalium memoria esse delapsum putent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut aliquem de caelo delapsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>.?*! intueri, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intuitus: <entryFree id="n24645" type="main" key="intu^i^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>intueor</etym>, <sense id="n24645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a look</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 2, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quaqua intuitus erat oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 7</bibl></cit> Müll. (ex conject.).— </sense><sense id="n24645.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:67" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:5" default="NO">48, 20, 5</bibl>; cf. 46, 1, 47.</sense></entryFree>
intumesco: <entryFree id="n24646" type="main" key="intu^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŭmesco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell up; to rise</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n24646.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus flatu intumescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 81, 83, § 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi virgineas intumuisse genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:700" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 700</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of dropsical persons: intumuit suffusā venter ab undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:215" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si partes corporis in vesicas intumuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24646.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be elevated</hi>, of the surface of the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">loco tamen ipso paululum intumescente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec intumescit alta viperis humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:52" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24646.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24646.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swell up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox intumescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <trans><tr>grows</tr>, <tr>increases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intumuere statim superbia ferociaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure quodam potestatis intumescere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be puffed up</tr>, <tr>elated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra humanum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 36</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24646.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become angry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intumuit vati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 487</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:582 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 582 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
intumulatus: <entryFree id="n24647" type="hapax" key="intu^mu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tŭmŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unburied</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intumus: <entryFree id="n24648" type="main" key="intu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭmus</orth>, v. intimus.</entryFree>
intundo: <entryFree id="n24649" type="main" key="intundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tundo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pound</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 71" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intuor: <entryFree id="n24650" type="main" key="intu^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭor</orth>, <itype>tŭi</itype>, v. intueor <sense id="n24650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inturbatus: <entryFree id="n24651" type="main" key="inturba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-turbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sedit inturbatus, interritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:64:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 64, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inturbidus: <entryFree id="n24652" type="main" key="inturbi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-turbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24652.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">inturbidus externis rebus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24652.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not turbulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir sanctus, inturbidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inturgesco: <entryFree id="n24653" type="main" key="inturgesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-turgesco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n24653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell up</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 56, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
intus: <entryFree id="n24654" type="main" key="intus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>1. in and the <case>abl.</case> termination -tus; Sanscr. -tas; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)nto/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n24654.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">On the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi intro atque intus subducam ratiunculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide sitne istaec nostra intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus insidiae sunt: intus inclusum periculum est: intus est hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">estne frater intus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus domique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae sunt intus in corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intus in mundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus in animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">intus in cella Fortis Fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te intus et in cute novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra et mtus hostem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">membris intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1091</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali intus templo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 192</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>in the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adductos intus agere equos,</quote> <trans><tr>closer to the goal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:586" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 586</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intus agere lacrimas,</quote> <trans><tr>to moderate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:Eleg. 114" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> Eleg. 114</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: intus canere, v. Aspendius.—</sense><sense id="n24654.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To the inside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (for the usual intro, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">intus novam nuptam deduxi viā, rectā,</quote> <trans><tr>into the house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit> dub. (al. intro): <cit><quote lang="la">die, me orare ut aliquis intus prodeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo simul atque intus est itum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit> (al. intro): <cit><quote lang="la">intus in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 711</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 457</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl>: pollice intus inclinato, <hi rend="ital">inwards</hi> ( = introrsus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24654.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">From within</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ndoqen,</foreign> ex interiore parte (mostly anteclass.;<cb n="INUN" />  cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 196</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tu in tus pateram proferto foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evocato aliquem intus ad te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">intus evocato aliquem foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum intus efferre foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsera otium intus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid spinosum est et intus eminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intusium: <entryFree id="n24655" type="main" key="intu^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intŭsĭum</orth>, v. indusium.</entryFree>
intutus: <entryFree id="n24656" type="main" key="intu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-tūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unguarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defenceless; unsafe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam intutam patiemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 1:48:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 1, 48, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">castra Gallorum intuta neglectaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde intuta quae indecora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1</bibl></cit>. 38: <cit><quote lang="la">stilo scribere intutum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 39, § 139</bibl></cit>. — In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">intūta</orth>; with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenium,</quote> <trans><tr>insecure parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 15, 6</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intutior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Constant. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
intybus: <entryFree id="n24657" type="main" key="inty^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">intybus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">intybum</orth>, v. intibus.</entryFree>
inuber: <entryFree id="n24658" type="hapax" key="i^nu_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūber</orth>, <itype>ūbēris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-fed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill-conditioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inudo: <entryFree id="n24659" type="hapax" key="i^nu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus labris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 418</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inula: <entryFree id="n24660" type="main" key="i^nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e(le/nion</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n24660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elecampane</hi>, a plant (Inula helenium, Linn.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 29, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inulcero: <entryFree id="n24661" type="hapax" key="i^nulce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ulcĕro</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ulcerate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inulte: <entryFree id="n24662" type="spur" key="i^nulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, false read. for inulti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl>; v. Mütz. ad h. 1.</entryFree>
inultus: <entryFree id="n24663" type="main" key="i^nultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n24663.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">For whom no revenge is taken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unavenged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unrevenged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not vindicated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24663.1" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius ne inultus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne inultos imperatores suos jacere sinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriemur inultae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non me inulto Victor laetabere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 739</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 297</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam inulti perierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hist. Fragm. 3, 74</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:233" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 233</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24663.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem suam ne inultam pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil poterit Juno, nisi inultos flere dolores?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Ptolemaeo inulta scelera fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandro caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24663.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Upon whom no revenge is taken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpunished.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24663.4" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam me inultus istic ludificabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur Asellium esse inultum tam diu sinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostīs inultos abire sinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes">70, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis Medeae nullus inultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 182</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24663.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24663.6" n="1" level="3"> Of things, for which no punishment is inflicted, <hi rend="ital">unpunished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque scelus inultum relinquendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid multis peccatur, inultum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 260</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24663.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Unharmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with impunity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inulto Dicere quod sentit permitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu sinas Medos equitare inultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at ne illud haud inultum, si vivo, ferent ( = inulti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed inultum numquam id auferet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et catulos ferae Celent inultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24663.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unsated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unappeased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insatiable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">preces,</quote> <trans><tr>unavailing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 28, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inumbratio: <entryFree id="n24664" type="main" key="i^numbra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnumbrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inumbro</etym>, <sense id="n24664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overshadowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inumbro: <entryFree id="n24665" type="main" key="i^numbro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-umbro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cast a shadow upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shade</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. opaco). </sense><sense id="n24665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terraque inumbratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toros obtentu frondis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 60</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24665.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24665.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cause darkness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inumbrante vespera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24665.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 913</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubem pallio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 254</bibl></cit>: ante genas quam flos juvenilis inumbret, Claud. Prob. et Olyb. 69.—</sense><sense id="n24665.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To mark the shadows upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mark out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay out</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">solarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n24665.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to obscure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoris adventu legatorum dignitas inumbratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:19:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inumbrata quies,</quote> <trans><tr>apparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:18:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 18, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inunco: <entryFree id="n24666" type="main" key="i^nunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-unco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. uncus</etym>, <sense id="n24666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch with hooks; to clutch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n24666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila unguibus agnum, leporem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="992" /> <cb n="INUR" /> p. 349, 9; Ccl. 7, 3, 10.— </sense><sense id="n24666.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: nummos, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 124, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inunctio: <entryFree id="n24667" type="main" key="i^nuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inunguo</etym>, <sense id="n24667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmearing with unguents; a spreading on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applying</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tridui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 29, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci plantaginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:33:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 33, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inunctus: <entryFree id="n24668" type="main" key="i^nunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from inunguo.</entryFree>
inundatio: <entryFree id="n24669" type="main" key="i^nunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnundātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inundo</etym>, <sense id="n24669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overflowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundation</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inundationes Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the deluge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 13, 14, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 34, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24669.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a crowd of people, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:249" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 249</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of horses: inundatione equorum ejus operiet te pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 26, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of troubles, sorrow, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 21, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inundo: <entryFree id="n24670" type="main" key="i^nundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-undo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n24670.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundate</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24670.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram inundet aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres campis inundantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis agros inundavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciliciam cruore Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruore campos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24670.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">run over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inundant Troes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimbros inundasse Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo inundaverat campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Europam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam urbem civilis sanguinis fluminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:551" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 551</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24670.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus ingenti flumine litterarum inundata,</quote> <trans><tr>overflowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24670.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24670.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To overflow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be inundated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deluged;</hi> of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">Arnus inundaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 32:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae super terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24670.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inundant sanguine fossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 382</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inungito: <entryFree id="n24671" type="main" key="i^nungi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnungĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n24671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. freq.</hi> [inunguo], <hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi> (ante-class.): capillum cinere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
inunguo: <entryFree id="n24672" type="main" key="i^nunguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-unguo</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">-go</orth>), <itype>unxi, unctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to anoint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n24672.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen idcirco contemnas lippus inungui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inunguendum primo lenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24672.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentem siccatam oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchis inuncta,</quote> <trans><tr>dressed with oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:78:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 78, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inunio: <entryFree id="n24673" type="main" key="i^nu_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūnĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inurbane: <entryFree id="n24674" type="main" key="i^nurba_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnurbānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inurbanus <sense id="n24674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inurbanus: <entryFree id="n24675" type="main" key="i^nurba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boorish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unpolishcd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmannerly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">habitus orationis non inurbanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:63:227" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 63, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non essem tam inurbanus ac paene inhumanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:90:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 90, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inurbanum lepido seponere dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 273</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inurbānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rudely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inelegantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without wit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inurbane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 5</bibl>; and, <orth extent="full" lang="la">inurbānĭter</orth> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. Manich. 12, 1.</sense></entryFree>
inurgeo: <entryFree id="n24676" type="main" key="i^nurge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-urgĕo</orth>, <itype>ursi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to push</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust; to obtrude</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1035" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1035</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susurros,</quote> <trans><tr>to be always whispering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inurino: <entryFree id="n24677" type="main" key="i^nu_ri_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūrīno</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n24677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to plunge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dive under the water</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">piscinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inuro: <entryFree id="n24678" type="main" key="i^nu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūro</orth>, <itype>ussi, ustum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to burn in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burn.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24678.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make an uneven hole</tr>, <tr>such as is made by burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of encaustic painting: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicias scripsit se inussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae tinguntur isdem his coloribus ad eas picturas quae inuruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 7, 31, § 49</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">To burn in</hi> a mark: <cit><quote lang="la">notas et nomina gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 158</bibl></cit>;
