<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inustis barbarum litterarum notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24678.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To burn off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove by burning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inustis infantum dexterioribus mammis ... unde Amazones dictae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro candente calcaribus inustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24678.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to brand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to imprint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attach indelibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua generi ac nomini suo nota nefariae turpitudinis inuratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas ille leges fuit impositurus nobis atque inusturus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: aliquid <cb n="INUT" /> calamistris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">censoriae severitatis nota inuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa probitatis ... domesticis inusta notis veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbissimum alicui dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui famam superbiae et crudelitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima mala rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivet semper in pectoribus illorum, quidquid istuc praesens necessitas inusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota turpitudinis inusta vitae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc dolorem cineri ejus atque ossibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">burned; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">inusta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">burned parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 14, 16, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inusitate: <entryFree id="n24679" type="main" key="i^nu_si^ta_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūsĭtātē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūsĭtātō</orth>, <sense id="n24679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. inusitatus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
inusitatus: <entryFree id="n24680" type="main" key="i^nu_si^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūsĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unusual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncommon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rare</hi> (class.): pro di immortales! speciem humanam inusitatam, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova et inusitata belli ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris oratoribus lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:81" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 81</bibl>: inusitatum est, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 1, 1</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species navium inusitatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: miracula, Aug. Civ. Dei, 10, 12.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n24680.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūsĭ-tātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unwonted manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unusually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">absurde et inusitate scriptae epistolae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta inusitatius contraxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inusitatissime nox pro noctu dixerunt (al. inusitate),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n24680.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūsĭtātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in an unusual manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5, 2</bibl></cit> (al. inusitato indicio enituit).</sense></entryFree>
inusque: <entryFree id="n24681" type="main" key="i^nusque^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-usquĕ</orth> (separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn usquĕ</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> for usque in, <sense id="n24681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">even unto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all the way to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:440" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Per. 525</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">641</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inustus: <entryFree id="n24682" type="main" key="i^nustus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. inuro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24683" type="main" key="i^nustus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n24683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not burned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unconsumed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa inustis plena medullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 787</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inusus: <entryFree id="n24684" type="spur" key="i^nu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūsus</orth>, <itype>ūs, false reading for in usu</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 65</bibl>.</entryFree>
inutilis: <entryFree id="n24685" type="main" key="i^nu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-ūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unserviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or with <case>dat.</case> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24685.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n24685.2" n="A" level="2"> Of persons. </sense><sense id="n24685.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo iners atque inutilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 647</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 794</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum meliorem ex ducibus inutilem vulnus faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24685.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aetatem ad pugnam inutiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rem gerendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24685.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate inutiles bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24685.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad navigandum inutiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas non inutilis ad capiendum consilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et nomen jactare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inutiles oratori universales quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:82" default="NO">5, 10, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad audiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non inutile sit imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO">1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:48" default="NO">11, 2, 48</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipulatio,</quote> <trans><tr>invalid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:97" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 2:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 261</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inutilissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24685.7" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24685.8" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosus et inutilis civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed sibi inutilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi reique publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 54" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24685.9" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">fungus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>, n. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">inutile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 45, § 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae inutiles pestilentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 100</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnū-tĭlĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n24685.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Uselessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inutiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24685.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injuriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">late diffusa aqua bibitur inutilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 65:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 65, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inutilitas: <entryFree id="n24686" type="main" key="i^nu_ti^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūtĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>inutilis</etym>. <sense id="n24686.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Uselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitableness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1274</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n24686.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hurtfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injuriousness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:52:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 52, 158</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inutiliter: <entryFree id="n24687" type="main" key="i^nu_ti^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnūtĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. inutilis <sense id="n24687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> <cb n="INVA" /></sense></entryFree>
inuus: <entryFree id="n24688" type="main" key="i^nu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭnŭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ineo; the fructifying god</etym>, <sense id="n24688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god</hi> Pan, <hi rend="ital">who gave fruitfulness to the herds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 22</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24688.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Castrum Inui</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-coast town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Antium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
inuxorus: <entryFree id="n24689" type="main" key="i^nuxo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ĭn-uxōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. in-uxor</etym>, <sense id="n24689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unmarried</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virginitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invado: <entryFree id="n24690" type="main" key="inva_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vādo</orth>, <itype>vāsi, vāsum</itype> (invasse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. 2, 4</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n24690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">get into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to enter upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24690.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis quocumque invasit, cuncta disturbat ac dissipat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul exercitusque Romanus sine certamine urbem invasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 33 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24690.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24690.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall into</hi>: ut profugiens hostem, inimici invadam manus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 234, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.4" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi> a distance: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo tria milia stadiorum invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enter upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set foot upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuque invade viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum minis frigidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24690.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enter violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">move against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invade</hi> (syn. oppugno); constr with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or simple <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n24690.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (so nearly always in Cic.; cf. II. B. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">in oppidum antiquum et vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in transversa latera invaserant cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus juvenum in ipsum consulem invadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in collum (mulieris) invasit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon her neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus pectus amplexibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem basiolis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 85</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with osculari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in eas (urbes) vi cum exercitu invasisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ferro in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculos invadi nunc est optimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem hastati invadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationem hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">validissimas Pompeii copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinos portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tandem invasit medios,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (Europam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lecto cubantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:210" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madida cum veste gravatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus invasit nubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes appropinquantem invadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem semel invasit senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperans, mox effusos hostes invadi posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 87 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signo dato, undique simul ex insidiis invaditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rush into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter hurriedly into</hi> a struggle, fight, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:57:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 57, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:199 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 199 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: in pugnas, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 323, 32</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aut pugnam aut aliquid jam dudum invadere magnum mens agitat mihi,</quote> <trans><tr>to attempt</tr>, <tr>enter hurriedly upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 186</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24690.10" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make an attack on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jubae barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum avidius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 20:9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineos artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 200</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24690.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24690.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurp;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or simple <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n24690.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multas pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quod ipsa invaderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fortunas alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in praedia alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomen Marii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem illius causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24690.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To make an attack on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay hold of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">befall</hi> a person or thing; with simple <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, or <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n24690.16" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gravis morbus invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne reliquos populares metus invaderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido Marium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 31, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus repente terror invasit, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24690.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor in oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis in vitam invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in philosophiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomen Marii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis avaritiae in animos eorum invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis morbi in corpus meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudine invaserunt misero (mihi) in genua flemina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>. <pb n="993" /> <cb n="INVE" /> — </sense><sense id="n24690.18" n="(g)" level="5"> Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor invaserat improbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 4</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24690.19" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pro continentiā et aequitate lubido atque superbia invasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi contagio quasi pestilentia invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum potentiā avaritia sine modo ... invasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24690.20" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To assail with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accost</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">continuo invadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippa consules anni prioris invasit, cur silerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vinnium Laco minaciter invasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">ingrafted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae, i. e. rami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invalentia: <entryFree id="n24691" type="main" key="inva^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vălentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n24691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">with imbecilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 11, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invaleo: <entryFree id="n24692" type="main" key="inva^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vălĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n24692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be strong against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prevail</hi> (late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">vique valebunt is the true reading,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 301</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.; and the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> invaluit belongs to invalesco; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.): <cit><quote lang="la">egredi conatus, invalente morbi gravitate detentus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invalesco: <entryFree id="n24693" type="main" key="inva^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vălesco</orth>, <itype>valŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n24693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [valeo], <hi rend="ital">to become strong;</hi> only trop. </sense><sense id="n24693.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow strong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum opibus invaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24693.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">predominate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido atque luxuria invaluerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellatio grammaticorum invaluit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gramm. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis invalescentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo cotidie magis invalescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic effectus (opp. nihil efficit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24693.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To come into use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba intercidunt, invalescuntque temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invaletudinarius: <entryFree id="n24694" type="spur" key="inva^le_tu_di^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invălētūdĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, false read. for in valetudinario, Sen. Q. N. praef. 5.</entryFree>
invaletudo: <entryFree id="n24695" type="main" key="inva^le_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vălētūdo</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. in</etym>, <sense id="n24695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">infirmity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sickness</hi> (very rare; not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Krebs, Antibarb. p. 621),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invalide: <entryFree id="n24696" type="main" key="inva^li^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invălĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. invalidus <sense id="n24696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
invalidus: <entryFree id="n24697" type="main" key="inva^li^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vălĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impotent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n24697.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camillus, jam ad munera corporis senectā invalidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucos graves aetate aut invalidos inveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ingrediendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus laborum impatiens invalidumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid tecum invalidum metuensque pericli est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:24" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with inermis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:21:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 245</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidiores Parthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidissimum urso caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24697.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inefficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inadequate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unsuitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes pro castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalida moenia adversum irrumpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invalidae ad hoc monstrum sugillandum litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionis praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>low</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>inadequate</tr>, <tr>depreciating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">invălĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">weakly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feebly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invanum: <entryFree id="n24698" type="spur" key="inva_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invānum</orth>, false read. for in vanum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 37</bibl>.</entryFree>
invasio: <entryFree id="n24699" type="main" key="inva_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invado</etym>, <sense id="n24699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invasion</hi> (post-class. for incursio, aggressio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 41</bibl> (48).</sense></entryFree>
invasor: <entryFree id="n24700" type="main" key="inva_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intruder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usurper</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 35</bibl>; Cod. 7, 4, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 6, § 20.</sense></entryFree>
invasus: <entryFree id="n24701" type="main" key="inva_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. invado <sense id="n24701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24702" type="main" key="inva_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invāsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>invado</etym>, only in <sense id="n24702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:82" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invecticius: <entryFree id="n24703" type="main" key="invecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>inveho</etym>, <sense id="n24703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imported</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not indigenous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not native</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n24703.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 3, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n24703.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>not hearty</tr>, <tr>not sincere</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invectio: <entryFree id="n24704" type="main" key="invecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n24704.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">importing</hi> of goods, <hi rend="ital">importation</hi> (opp. exportatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem flumine invectio,</quote> <trans><tr>the entrance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 70</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24704.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An attacking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assailing with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an inveighing against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tullianae severae invectiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, p. 15</bibl></cit> Munck. <cb n="INVE" /></sense></entryFree>
invectivaliter: <entryFree id="n24705" type="hapax" key="invecti_va_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectīvālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>invectio</etym>, <sense id="n24705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with invectives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpere vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invectivus: <entryFree id="n24706" type="main" key="invecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scolding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abusive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproachful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of invectives</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio acer, et invectiva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vectīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">invectives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam in principem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invector: <entryFree id="n24707" type="main" key="invector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inveho</etym>, <sense id="n24707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who brings in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an importer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lanati pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:27" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invectrix: <entryFree id="n24708" type="main" key="invectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>invector</etym>, <sense id="n24708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that brings in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">introduces</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 63, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invectus: <entryFree id="n24709" type="main" key="invectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. inveho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n24710" type="main" key="invectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">invectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>inveho</etym>, <sense id="n24710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing in</hi> (post-Aug.), only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae invectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; with <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae nascuntur fluminum invectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24710.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an importation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
inveho: <entryFree id="n24711" type="main" key="inve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕho</orth>, <itype>vexi, vectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n24711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> a place, in one's hands, on a horse, by water, etc. </sense><sense id="n24711.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24711.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24711.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum in aerarium pecuniae invexit, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates in Mesopotamiam quasi novos agros invehit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n24711.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> of place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, except with names of towns, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">marmor Romam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 8, § 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 12, § 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iamque mare (lyra et lingua) invectae flumen relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 54</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24711.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar legiones per flumen Oceano invexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gazam urbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (opes) mare litoribus invehit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 2, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24711.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. frumenta), <hi rend="ital">into the barns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 303</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinas mercis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n24711.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24711.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">into</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator triumphans urbem invehitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invecta corpori patris nefando vehiculo filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 59, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Caesar triplici invectus Romano triumpho moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invehitur celeri barbarus hostis equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum acies invecta in dissipatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 34, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 18, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 571</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invectus mare,</quote> <trans><tr>carried into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in portum ex alto invehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum invectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 84</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab invectis portum audit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 7</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classes invectas Tibridis alveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 436</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostio fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24711.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum utrimque invehi hostem nunciaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander ordines . . . multa caede hostium invehitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24711.10" n="C" level="2"> Invehere se, or invehi, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assault; to force one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invehebant se hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo ipso acrius victores se undique inveherent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 18</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Valerius temere invectus in aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">equites in laevum cornu invecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:2" default="NO">4, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:15" default="NO">8, 14, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua invehebatur ordinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus in phalangem invecti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 15, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n24711.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24711.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to introduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (mala) tibi casus invexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem incommodorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quemcumque casum fortuna invexerit,</quote> <trans><tr>brings with it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: divitiae avaritiam invexere, Liv. praef. § 12.— </sense><sense id="n24711.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack with words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inveigh against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in homines caros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:75:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 75, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod consul in eum ordinem essct invectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbius in aliquem, id, Lael. 16, 57: in adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:29" default="NO">2, 15, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Philotam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid inclementius in te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius in causam principum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">* de quo Caesar in senatu aperte in te invehens questus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 74</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nonnulla inveheretur in Timoleonta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa in Thebanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,015:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">invectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">brought in</hi>: invecta et illata (or without et): invecta illata, <hi rend="ital">things brought into a house</hi> by the tenant, i. e. his <hi rend="ital">movables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">household stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furniture</hi>: placet, in urbanis habitationibus locandis, invecta illata,<cb n="INVE" />  pignori esse locatori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invecta et illata pignori erunt obligata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invelatus: <entryFree id="n24712" type="main" key="inve_la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vēlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unveiled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 43, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invenalis: <entryFree id="n24713" type="gloss" key="inve_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vēnālis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)/pra=tos,</foreign> <sense id="n24713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not for sale</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
invendibilis: <entryFree id="n24714" type="hapax" key="invendi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vendĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsalable</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">merx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
invenditus: <entryFree id="n24715" type="main" key="invendi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vendĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unsold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:10:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 5, 10, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inveniabilis: <entryFree id="n24716" type="main" key="inve^ni^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕnĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n24716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not pardonable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 35, § 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
invenio: <entryFree id="n24717" type="main" key="inve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">in-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (<sense id="n24717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> invenibit for inveniet, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 479, 28</bibl>), lit., <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light upon</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to find</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with</hi> (cf.: reperio, offendo). </sense><sense id="n24717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque domi, neque in urbe invenio quemquam, qui illum viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agro populabundum hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio mortuus in cubiculo inventus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves reliquas paratas ad navigandum invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabiles oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: scis, Pamphilam meam inventam civem? <hi rend="ital">is found to be a citizen</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s daughter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 6</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque inventu rara ac difficilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n24717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n24717.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quandam fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciem aliis, ac postremo sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—Of an orator's faculty of invention: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta in eo inveniendi copia et eloquendi facultas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: multa divinitus a majoribus nostris inventa atque instituta sunt, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 1.— </sense><sense id="n24717.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inveniebat ex captivis, Sabim flumen ab suis castris non amplius milia passuum decem abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud auctores invenio eodem anno descisse Antiates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 45</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n24717.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi> how to do a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ille quomodo crimen commenticium confirmaret, non inveniebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus inveniet puero succumbere furtim,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will find out a way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1</bibl></cit> (8), 9, 35.—</sense><sense id="n24717.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut facillume Sine invidia laudem invenias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui primus hoc cognomen invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illi gloria opesque inventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24717.7" n="E" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">se.</hi> </sense><sense id="n24717.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To show itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam se dolor invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 113</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n24717.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be at home</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">minus se inveniunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are perplexed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec medici se inveniunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventarium: <entryFree id="n24718" type="main" key="inventa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>invenio</etym>, <sense id="n24718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a list</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventory</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:1" default="NO">27, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:15 al" default="NO">42, 5, 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
inventio: <entryFree id="n24719" type="main" key="inventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n24719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invention</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n24719.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa vis quae investigat occulta, quae inventio atque excogitatio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:72" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n24719.2" n="II" level="1"> Rhet., <hi rend="ital">the faculty of invention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventio est excogitatio rerum verarum aut verisimilium, quae causam probabilem reddant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partes eae (rhetoricae artis) . . . inventio, dispositio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventiuncula: <entryFree id="n24720" type="main" key="inventi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>inventio</etym>, <sense id="n24720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trifling invention</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">minimis inventiunculis gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
inventor: <entryFree id="n24721" type="main" key="inventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">inventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>invenio</etym>, <sense id="n24721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that finds out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contriver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discoverer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inventor</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">o mearum voluptatum omnium Inventor, inceptor, perfector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristaeus, qui olivae dicitur inventor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:164 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 164 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventor legis Volero,</quote> <trans><tr>proposer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum,</quote> <trans><tr>founder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 131</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes inventoribus afferunt laudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:23" default="NO">8, 6, 23</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
